Reviews.Content: We needed replacement for an older model of a similar camera, the price was the lowest we could find, and the camera is serving us very well

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: J. Gail Shull
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a birthday gift to replace a 5 MP camera that was starting to have problems.  It is easy to use and has the features that I was looking for.  The camera it replaced was thinner and flat, which I liked since it easily fit in my pocket. In general, I like it at least as much as the previous camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan Orr
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent.  I bought it to use as my back up camera for my  vacation to Montana.  I ended up using this camera and leaving my "good camera" at home.  I was not disappointed.  I didn't have a neck strap for it so that caused some inconvenience but otherwise it was fantastic.  Some of the reviews complain about battery time.  I had no problem with that.  I took over 250 pictures on one set of  batteries.  I bought a dry bag that fit the camera wonderfully for when we were fishing the Yellowstone river.  I have always had great experiences with Canon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Canon has done it again!
Reviews.Author: Kittygrandma
Reviews.Content: I just received my new camera. It takes great pix & does what my last camera did just as well. Can't go wrong with Canon. I love the red color. Stands out & easy to find when needed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and accessories
Reviews.Author: Montana Fisherman
Reviews.Content: Camera was everything we expected. I have not really used it much but going through the camera features and operations, I expect it to be perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Constance
Reviews.Content: It is a long lens and the pictures are nice and clear.  We live by a lake and i enjoy taking pictures of the birds.I also bought a battery charger and i like having the 2 aa batterries.Good photos.....not a compact but a nice size camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX160IS
Reviews.Author: M. J. Wenzel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have the Canon Power Shot S5IS and also love it, but it's big and bulky when traveling. The SX160IS fits into my purse perfectly.  The buttons are very similar to the S5IS, so I didn't have to learn much.  And the picture quality is great.  It's a little bigger than a lot of the "smaller" cameras but I find that makes it easier to hold and not move when taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: great camera for price
Reviews.Author: Neill Singletary
Reviews.Content: camera does almost everything well - my only complaint is the cycle time between shots - much faster than my other cameras in this price range, but I can't stand to wait for anything.  It would be hard for me to believe there is a better camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: its a canon
Reviews.Author: bradwyatt83
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Got it for my grandma (who isn't tech savy at all) and she can work the camera great. I lovve that it takesAA batterys

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Shea Hunderman
Reviews.Content: love this camera!! Would by over and over again! only issue is the battery's not lasting long, but doesn't bother me too much!

Reviews.Title: Very Snazzy
Reviews.Author: Absolver
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my wife and she absolutely loves it. There are a TON of features so it's really worth your time to read the manual and play with it but it does EVERYTHING has a GREAT zoom takes SHARP pictures and it saves very quickly to my SD card.

Reviews.Title: Wow,,,what a great camera & what a great price!
Reviews.Author: P.Lannon
Reviews.Content: I'm going on a once in a lifetime trip in November to Africa on Safari.  While I am shelling out a lot of money to do this...I didn't feel I could spend a lot of money on a camera.  I'm just not that savy with cameras.  A friend has a Canon Sure Shot and she recommended it to me.  So I saw this one on Amazon and ordered it. OMG  it's terrific!  The price is unbelievelable and the features are amazing.  I will never be an expert photo journalist, but this Canon Sure Shot will assist me in taking photos for my once in a life time adventure and it will not leave me destitute!  It's easy to use...the owners manual downloads on your computer and even I can figure it out.  I have practiced taking photos of my grand kids and at my local zoo.  All terrific.  I bought 2 additional Memory Cards and I can't wait to get to Kenya and start taking pictures of Lions & Zebra and such.  While, I will never be published on National Geographic....this camera will allow me to capture a once in a lifetime adventure and to have the photos as memories until the day I die.  It's a great value and a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good cheap camera
Reviews.Author: F. Whitmore
Reviews.Content: Fine camera for job site pictures, it's sturdy, runs on AA batteries, and easy to use for technically challenged users.Simple is good where I work and this camera fills the bill.

Reviews.Title: Worked outtttttttttttttt greattttttt
Reviews.Author: Pranav Doshi
Reviews.Content: Had to get a camera for someone else.....went with canon and did not wanted something too expensive....this one made my day....The results are great and sometime I thought that they are better then my 6 yrs old D-SLR (worth 2k at that time)

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Keala hollis
Reviews.Content: I rate it good quality! I like everything about it and it was in good shape when it came to me. It also came in the  time expected . There isn't anything i don't like about it. I would defiantly recommend this product

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: SST
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an earlier model of the same basic camera.  It was great but died so bought this one.  It has a better zoom andworks great.

Reviews.Title: zoom-tastic!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "s.berry"
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA for the price. we love it. it's terrific for zooming in when the kids are playing at the park or just hanging out at home. the options are fantastic (the husband has toyed around with them) but it's really easy to use. i thought the battery thing would bother me a lot, but it's manageable.. would recommend

Reviews.Title: Camera is very user friendly!
Reviews.Author: Charlie Gaetjens
Reviews.Content: This camera makes awesome pictures.  I point and click, and to my surprise - they look like I know what I'm doing.  The camera is not heavy, easy to travel with, and gives me the little extras I need, to help me catch a beautiful AZ sunset, lightening striking in the desert sky, a smile on a small childs face, etc.  I am very pleased with this camera and all the memories it gives me.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera!
Reviews.Author: Vicki Fotheringham "V. Fotheringham"
Reviews.Content: I got this instead of spending hundreds of dollars on a great camera.  I needed to get one quickly and have not been disappointed in it yet.  It takes great photos, is easy to use, and small enough to be an easy carry!

Reviews.Title: powershot
Reviews.Author: Adelia Vigil
Reviews.Content: good overall camera, smarter than user! Images are great for general picture taking, videos more clear than my old camera.

Reviews.Title: Nothing bad to say, perfect for what it is
Reviews.Author: smartwaffle "jd22527"
Reviews.Content: I am usually an DSLR user but I needed a quick snapshot camera. I have had multiple iterations of this camera over the years and I love it.

Reviews.Title: This camera has a split personality..Really!
Reviews.Author: David Bailey
Reviews.Content: OK, so thats not so surprising when you consider that it's a camera AND a motion picture video do-jiggy. Whew..that just takes my breath away! I purchased this because it's a Canon, has a big zoooom and takes AA batteries. Photo's come out crisp with real nice color and contrast. Video's? Not broadcast quality but close enough for me to become a mild mannered videographer at the Daily Planet. The beautiful thing is it does all the work. Oh sure, you have to press a button or two but after that, Shazam. The little wizard inside takes nice exposures from an apparently inexhaustable supply of film, developes them (without messy chemies) and stores them for you. A very considerate little guy. I wasn't going to say anything but I think this camera is smarter than I am.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Breezyk
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for!  A small, easy to use camera that takes GREAT pictures!  A few people expressed concern with this camera not taking good action shots but I have not found that to be true.  We have two very active puppies which I have got great action photos of.  Better than any camera I've ever had!  I also love that it uses AA batteries which can be found anywhere that I'm traveling.  This camera is absolutely perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Tackledummy
Reviews.Content: Once you RTFM, this camera is awesome.  You definitely need to tweak some settings instead of shooting everything in "AUTO" mode.  If you want a point-and-shoot, get something different.  This camera has more settings than most normal people would even bother to mess with, but that's exactly what I was looking for.  If you're thinking about dabbling into photography, or just want to get all artsy and take some cool shots, this camera is the one you want.  Zoom feature is awesome and really powerful.NOTE: Get some rechargeable AA batteries or else you'll go through batteries faster than the Energizer bunny.  I bought this camera specifically because I wanted one that ran on AA's.  I've had it with battery packs and chargers failing, having to buy ones that are almost as much as a new camera.  With AA's, you ALWAYS have power no matter what.  Just get some rechargeable Ni-Cad's.  They'll last longer and you'll help save the planet!  Not really, but they WILL last longer.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX160
Reviews.Author: Harry B
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money I wanted to spend. The camera met all my expectations. Simple to use and very intuitative.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product. Look no more for your digital camera
Reviews.Author: WFG
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the 2009 model of this camera the SX120. When we saw this one came out, we thought we were ready for an upgrade, not because we needed it, but because the new upgrades seemed nice. I'm glad we upgraded. The 16x zoom is great (we had 10x before) and the 16 MP make a great difference. The auto-focus also seems to be faster, and battery life seems a bit improved.Pros:More zoom: 16xOutstanding priceUses 2aa batteries (we have ran out of batteries in foreign countries, and it was very easy to find replacements to continue taking pictures)Awesome picture qualityEasy to useCons:Cover not included (they use to in previous models)No GPS or wi-fi (most other alternatives don't include this either, but it 2012. Time to catch up Canon)Can't use screw up lense filters

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Novice as Well as Semi-Pro!
Reviews.Author: FM Rose "FM Rose"
Reviews.Content: I consider myself cusping on the semi-pro level as I have several years of experience with mostly NIkon DSLRs.  The weight around my neck with those heavy cameras can be over bearing when it comes to a full day of shooting.Was wanting a small camera that I could wear on a belt (with case loop) and with a zoom range that would work for 90% of my photo needs.  This camera has that range (28mm-300mm), is light, provides excellent colors, has all the modes for shooting that I would ever care for, is decent when it comes to noise (anything over 800 is not pleasant).  Since I live in sunny Florida and take most of my pics outdoors, this is rarely an issue.Very happy with my results so far and it will be my camera of choice when the Nikon creates pain.  Only thing is, should have waited for price drop.........it is really a value below $150.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: J. R. Wechezak "Joe"
Reviews.Content: Received as a gift purchased at Best Buy (paid $15 more than Amazon price).I was very excited to receive this camera on Father's Day, June 16, 2013. After reading the manual, we immediately took it on a trip to the west coast. We shot over 400 pictures using several different cameras while on the trip: the Canon SX160, a phone camera, and lesser model Canon. When we returned home and loaded the pictures on the PC, I was amazed to see how poorly the Canon SX160IS compared to the same pictures from other cameras. As an example, with pictures of the desert (i can send provide examples) the SX160 had a faded look to it and the clarity was just 'ok'...while the other pictures were vibrant and clear. With indoor pictures using a flash, they were very grainy even using the low light features...unacceptable. It would have gone unnoticed had we not had other pictures to compare to...taken at the same time at the same place. Because of my extreme disappointment, I decided to return the camera to Best Buy and get something else. I explained to them the camera did not take good pictures and I'd like refund. Since it was purchased on June 12, and I requested a refund on July 2 after I returned from vacation, I was told it was purchased 20 days ago which is beyond the 15-day policy. I proceeded to explain the camera wasn't functioning properly and I was very disappointed with the picture quality. The sales person took the camera, snapped a few pictures in the store and said "it is working fine". After escalating to the Store General manager, James Pascoe - store #587, and arguing with him for 10 minutes I was told "We just can't accept returns from people who don't want their cameras anymore". My options were to keep the camera or "have it serviced and Best Buy will 100% determine whether it takes good pictures" and that was it. I like to spread my business around and purchase locally as well as via the internet. Needless to say Bust Buy just made a very easy decision for me as I will NEVER purchase from them again after receiving this type of poor, unprofessional customer service - and not standing behind what they sell. I was hoping they would survive in this tough industry, but with policies and customer service like this Best Buy won't last much longer.  Lesson learned:  I'll stick with Amazon from now on...

Reviews.Title: Good camera for everyday shooting.
Reviews.Author: Mark Hanlon
Reviews.Content: As a former photojournalist, I selected this Canon because it is a good everyday camera andhas both automatic and manual operation.

Reviews.Title: Flash feature is a real downer
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: First, the camera takes good photos and video, and is faster than my old Canon.  My big complaint with this camera how very slow and cumbersome the flash is.  Many good photos were missed waiting for the flash.  Even being proactive, and starting the flash before starting to take photos didn't work, as the flash times out very quickly - once the button is depressed to take the photo, the flash starts to warm up again, and the photo opportunity is missed.  If you're taking photos of kids or pets, this is a problem.  The good news is that this camera  takes decent photos without the flash, even in lower lighting, so I don't bother with it and so far, have gotten by okay.  But "getting by okay" is not what I expected from a camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: One of the best except for several serious flaws.
Reviews.Author: Carolina Fan
Reviews.Content: As a semi-pro who's evolved from his own darkroom with multiple Nikon SLRs to just finding the best point and shoot out there, this one comes close. It does have many more "user defined features and options" than the Nikon L 610, both of which I own, but it fails in comparison to the Nikon in a number of very important areas. (You'll also see that the price for the SX160 is dropping weekly and is now below the Nikon L 610 as more buyers realize the shortcomings of this camera.)The 3" display is inferior. It has a measly 230,000 pixels, while all the other cameras in it's class- such as the Nikon L 610 have a razor sharp 460,000 dot display. Canon needs to fix this pronto. Your pictures will look much better than they show up on this Canon's muddy display. If you want a crisp display, buy the Nikon L 610.The Canon's CMOS, while the same size as the Nikon's- 1"x2.3" is not as sensitive for sharp pics in lower light without flash. At ISOs at or above 400, (e.g. taking pictures of the baby while she's asleep) the Canon's pictures are dim and dark compared to the Nikon L 610.The lag time between shots is noticeably longer with the Canon versus the Nikon using the same- and best available- SanDisk, class 10, 45MB/s, 16gig card - probably because the Nikon has a user defined menu/circuitry option to allow you to define the type of AA you're using-alkaline, rechargeable or lithium and take advantage of the lithiums superior capacity.This is a AA camera- which is it's charm.  Forget all the review "noise" about alkaline AAs or AA rechargeable batteries, which will be an ongoing misery.  Just get a big pack of Energizer Lithium Extreme 9X AA's from Amazon. A pair will last well over 200 shots with flash.The SX 160 has two strap attachment points on the camera, but sadly, Canon and also Nikon with their L 610, only ship a one point wrist strap. If you still want to buy this camera, or the Nikon, solve this this by ordering the Nikon AN-CP23 strap from Amazon. Minimal mass, tiny logos, tucks neatly in your bag and, most of all, lets you hang the camera around your neck!The very best case for the Canon SX 160 or the Nikon L 610, is the Tamrac 5292. Fits perfectly, holds 4 AAs, an extra card and your cable.The best 3" display protector for either, is the "GGS optical glass protector". Be aware of counterfeits- get it "fulfilled by Amazon."Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: I really wanted to love this camera but.....
Reviews.Author: The Silva7
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but great success with Canon cameras but this camera eats AA batteries left and right. I wanted an up to date camera and this one was to fit the bill.... BUT trying to take clear pictures of my newborn child and catching those unforgettable moments are coming out blurry and it can't be relied upon for videos when it always says "battery low" or when using the flash when it says "charging battery" and the photo taking opportunity is gone! I thought the blurry pictures were because of me but when taking a video and staying real still and with brand new batteries installed, the video would go from clear to blurry to clear to blurry....for whatever reason, I don't know!!!  I wish I could return it for a Canon camera (Powershot 12.1 megapixel) like my daughter's who has a rechargeable battery and excellent picture and video quality!

Reviews.Title: Great Features for the Price.  NOT THE RIGHT CAMERA FOR FAMILY GATHERINGS, FAST POINT AND SHOOT SITUATIONS, ETC
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: The 16X OPTICAL zoom and 16.0 MP are what you expect from Canon, even at this low price - GREAT. Super versatile camera, but much too slow focusing and arriving at exposure solutions to use say, at a wedding, a party, etc.Sharpness is good to Excellent throughout the zoom range.  RECOMMENDED TO PHOTOGRAPHERS WITH EXPERIENCE IN HIGH ZOOM LENSES.The high zoom power results in very high minimum F-stops when zoomed out, meaning you have to boost the ISO greatly under moderate light.  Also, the camera is not capable (at all) of focusing in low light with high zoom.  None of this is surprising given the high lens power and the low price point.  If you are looking for a pocket camera for well-lit (outdoor) situations, capturing wildlife, vacation landscapes, and photos of companions in good lighting, this can be a fine camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Dogluvr
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my Canon PowerShot SX 110IS which I had dropped and broken.  It is good, though I still liked the SX110IS the best for point and shoot pictures.

Reviews.Title: super camera
Reviews.Author: Roy Kerr
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!!!  Takes beautiful pictures,  very true color come across.  I take most of my pictures for ebay and I have found it to be a great asset yo my business.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: Ron Boyd
Reviews.Content: This camera had everything I was looking for: separate date/time battery; 16x zoom; separate flash w/choice of using or not;and other features I was looking for. I like it, but that's my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Camera and better deal than Wal MArt!!
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: My fiance is extremely happy with the camera it does anything and everything we expected. Very grateful we were able to get such a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Palmi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and I had taken an excellent pics.  Like a professional.  I love my camera,I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great value on an awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Schenfeld
Reviews.Content: Meets and exceeds every expectation, especially the next-day delivery.Perfect for industrial documentation photos and HD videos without the bulk of a DSLRWould recommend without hesitation

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Harold W. Melius
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife.  She likes an easy to use "Point and shoot" style.  It takes great phots's in about any condition and uses AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Virag "bookworm"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband who is not at all tech savvy.  This camera is so easy to use and takes great pictures.  Comes with cord to hook up to PC, no software down necessary

Reviews.Title: Great Camera but Difficult Focus at times
Reviews.Author: Kirsten
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. The video quality is amazing and the pictures look professional. It's great for zooming in on birds outside my window. I was really happy when I realized there is a macro lens feature, meaning you can take close up pictures of things and get them really detailed (example: pollen on a flower).Yes, this camera takes two AA batteries. That can either be a good thing or a bad thing depending on what kind of pictures you want.Cameras that use batteries are good because:1. You can use rechargeable batteries so you don't have to keep buying new batteries. You just buy some rechargeable batteries and put them into the charger when you're done using the camera at night (on whenever).2. If you're going on a hike or birding or anything like that that's outside for a long time, you can just bring a few re-chargeable batteries in your pocket and change the batteries once or twice so you can use the camera all day. This is much better than cameras that have to be charged because with a rechargeable camera, it wouldn't last you the whole day and you wouldn't have an outlet nearby to charge it with.So this camera is great with the whole rechargeable batteries thing.However, if you really don't want to deal with batteries, you can go for the Canon SX170. It's the exact same features, but instead of taking batteries, you plug it into the wall to charge it. Again, though, I recommend this camera a lot more.The only thing that made me give it four stars was that the focus is sometimes a little messed up. It won't focus on the object right sometimes so it will either come out blurry or the focus will be on something else in the picture rather than the target. However, this only happens sometimes, usually when I'm zooming in on really far away things, so the camera will focus on bushes or trees around the subject instead or the constant movement of the camera will make it blurry.To fix this, you can usually depress the "shoot" button halfway and the camera will focus on the subject. This works beautifully 95% of the time.The last complaint I have is that it doesn't capture moving objects well. They'll always come out a little blurry. However, for a camera of this price, it has amazing quality. It's a point and shoot camera, after all; if you want to take perfectly clear pictures of moving objects, invest in a $300 camera or more.The blurriness of quickly moving objects never bothered me because I don't take many pictures like that, but if you want to capture running children or cars or hyperactive pets, you may want to invest in a better camera. However, be warned that it would be much more expensive.The video records beautifully in 720pHD and the sound is clear.The camera comes with the camera itself, two AA batteries so you can use it right away, a data chord (NOT TO RECORD; it's to plug it into a computer to upload pictures), a wrist strap (I recommend you buy a neck strap separately; I'll attach a link below), a solution disk (whatever that is), a one-year warranty, and an instruction manual.Overall, it is an excellent camera for the price. I'm very happy with it.For a good neck strap: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0018MR5HK/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_1If you want the same camera but rechargeable rather than taking batteries: http://www.amazon.com/Canon-PowerShot-SX170-Digital-Black/dp/B00EFILR6E/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1399745357&sr;=8-1&keywords;=canon+170sx(Same features, just different power supply.)For rechargeable batteries with a charger: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00DNPT1CM/ref=oh_details_o01_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1(Click the product box titled "4 Pack AA with Charger".

Reviews.Title: If U Find it Buy it!
Reviews.Author: L. I. Coleman "Thrill Seeker"
Reviews.Content: Great digicam, does it all, and runs on AA's; takes great photos, awesome video - terrific price!Has been discontinued by Canon.

Reviews.Title: Worst digital camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Gator Dad
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera mainly because my spouse wanted something she could use regular batteries in. With her old but reliable Kodak camera you had to have a separate charger which would tend to run out of energy always at the wrong moment. This camera not only eats batteries like candy but has issues with exposure and flash charging. Stay away from this model.

Reviews.Title: Baffled, need help...
Reviews.Author: Melinda Sullivan
Reviews.Content: The pictures I have been taking are somewhat grainy.  After I take the pic and see it, the word busy shows up on the bottom most times.  I'm sure I have some sort of setting wrong, but just wanted it to take very clear pictures.  Can anyone tell me what may be wrong with this.  I might have to send back?  Any other recommendations for a beautiful picture camera, that is very easy to use?  Would so appreciate some feedback.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Joan Behonick
Reviews.Content: I love the size and ease of using this camera.  The zoom is just enough for most photos and I have some of my best photos from using it.  The reason I chose this model is it uses 4-AA batteries - I don't have to use a rechargeable battery (rechargeables have NEVER worked out for me, always failed at the wrong time)

Reviews.Title: Always good.
Reviews.Author: R Butterfield
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected. Canon has never disappointed me.I always look to canon products first. Buy some rechargeable batteries to go with it.

Reviews.Title: Battery sucker but good
Reviews.Author: Paradox Owl
Reviews.Content: It's a good little point a shoot camera with a pretty good zoom. The only real problem is that it is a real battery sucker! In just 5 hours I went through 3 sets of batteries!

Reviews.Title: Superb Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: French Fry
Reviews.Content: This camera met or exceeded my expectations.  I chose it because I had an older Canon Power Shot that I really liked AND because this camera uses two AA batteries.  Also, the batteries last a very long time.  It is pocket sized, not bulky, and can easily fit into any purse.  I recommend this camera for anyone: those who just want to take pictures for a pastime or for the real camera buffs who don't want to tote their larger cameras to sporting events, etc.  It is simple to operate and has a large 3-inch view screen.  The pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Whoops
Reviews.Author: Visa "Mudda"
Reviews.Content: I wish there was a view finder- impossible to see the display 0n a bright day.  Regular batteries- short life.  I have had this camera less than 6 mn.  The exsposure  button flew off after taking an exsposure and the button hit my granddaughter on the cheek.  Dangerous!!  Easy to use and pics are good.  Fun to use with grandkids and experiment with pictures.  COB

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: All the bells and whistels of the expensive DSLR at a lower price. Easy to use in any mode. Small and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Last-Minute Choice... Not Regretted for Even a Minute!
Reviews.Author: Ace-of-Stars
Reviews.Content: Just before "taking a big chance" with this purchase, I was *LITERALLY* less than 30 seconds away from clicking the "Place Your Order" button for the Fujifilm "FinePix S6800."The reason why? Because even though I'd always avoided "Canon" products in the past, I'd wanted something more versitile than the Nikon "Coolpix L18" (which I'll never recommend due to several common and legitimate complaints about both the company and their products) which I was replacing, but I was also hoping to find something that fell somewhat close within a similar price range... and the Canon "PowerShot SX160IS" seemed to offer something fairly close enough within those parameters to at least pique my interest.So old prejudices aside, I'd decided to look very closely at the SX160 -- design, features, legacy, etc., and everything seemed more or less appealing on the surface.So why was I being so apprehensive? Because everywhere I looked to get more information about the camera and how it performs, there were always a significant number of people who would either "downplay" it and its abilities or outright trash-talk it. And since "positive ratings" in the form of "owner feedback" and "reviews" are extremely important to me, especially where it concerns items of interest where I've little or no foreknowledge, I took these less-than-stellar opinions as my cue to look elsewhere, and this search led me to the Fujifilm "FinePix S6800," which had OVERWHELMING positive feedback and reviews with almost nothing that was anything less than glowing praisebeing expressed about the unit. So despite the fact that I thought the camera was uglier than a meth addicts teeth and that it would cost me an additional $50 more than the Canon, I took that new knowledge and had just positioned my cursor over the order confirmation button... then I hesitated.Why? Because I had not really put examining the Fujifilm S6800 through quite the same rigid scrutiny as I'd done with the SX160, because all of the praises that were being heaped upon the Fuji were enough for me to lower my guard and momentarily disrupt my objectivity. So I had to go back and look closer at the S6800 the same way as I had with the SX160 -- by looking at examples of what it actually does!So I returned to the video hosting sites where ordinary people had posted examples of things they'd done with their respective cameras, and as for photo quality there was little if any discernable difference between the SX160 and the S6800; where "video" had been shot however, examples of the Fuji did occasionally appear "unstable," although that could've just as well been due to hardware/software compatibility issues with the camera and/or the computer. But there was *ONE* thing in particular that I'd overlooked which I definitely felt needed to be assessed, and that was that I had never replayed an uploaded video where a test of the "telephoto lens" on the S6800 was being showcased! The "quiet" motor (though not entirely of course) of the SX160 was impressive enough for me to sit up and take real notice... but as soon as I played back uploaded media of users engaging the zoom lens feature on the Fuji and heard that horribly loud & nerve-grating grinding engine noise, and in other instances the camera microphone's pee-poor ability to even remotely buffer the sound of the wind blowing into it, *THAT* was the game-changer for me!Since I've had the SX160 (which I chose over the SX170 because I want the flexibility of "AA batteries" rather than some "proprietary" leg trap), I have nothing but wonderful things to say about it. No, it doesn't take the absolute crispest photographs in the world (can't reasonably expect "$500+ results" at "$200- prices"), but it perfoms lightyears beyond what I could get from my Nikon Coolpix! Videos shot are sharp and smooth (though as of yet I've not tested this in a "speed tracking" setting), and the telephoto is awesome for taking photographs (I've recently taken some amazing shots of the moon both in daylight and nighttime sessions) and is again reasonably quiet for video shoots!As for the most common complaints I keep coming across... yes, it does a sucky job at shooting "snow scenery" -- the first time I'd tried it, all I got was nothing but a blank white canvas -- but there's a very simple solution to this problem: Take the setting off of "AUTO" and switch it over to "MANUAL" and adjust your appertures and ISO speeds! If this sounds like a foreign language, READ THE MANUAL and/or get together with someone who can instruct you in at least the main "basics" of DIY photography.But therein lies a couple of real and legitimate problems: one of the main ones being that the "instruction" booklet is only available as a PDF file, so you need a computer to access it, as they've offered no "physical" paper-&-Ink booklet which would've been so much more convenient; and as far as the "manual" adjusting goes, the setting wheel is so close to the other buttons on the back which are so hyper-sensitive that great care and lots of practice must be taken in order to avoid unintended mishaps. The "grainy" resolution of the view screen is another area in which I can come down on the side of agreement (the Nikon L18, believe it or not, is superior in this aspect), but any talk about "grainy pictures" is just ludicrous -- again, it can often be about apperture and ISO settings and too much reliance on the "automatic" setting... "nighttime/low-light" situations, same thing, despite the fact that I've managed to take some remarkable photos in some of those very same night and low-light situations, EVEN ON THE "AUTO" SETTING!My only real complaint (other than the unavailability of a hard copy owner's manual) is that the SX160 has *NO* internal memory at all, not even in the slightest! (Heck! Even the Nikon "Coolpix" L18 comes with about 9-pictures worth of memory preinstalled), so in order to get any usage from the SX at all, you'll have to cough up them ducats for a good ("fast") memory card.Needless to say, I am (so far) very happy with this camera: it does pretty much everything I expected it to do, and then some! I can only hope as I experiment with it more and more that I will likewise grow more and more fond of it and receive much enjoyment from it. If the words of an "Almost-Skeptic" bear any weight in these reviews, then please allow me to say with no shame or regret... I RECOMMEND THIS!!!

Reviews.Title: not a good camera
Reviews.Author: patrick j welsh
Reviews.Content: i get to take 4 or 5 pictures and the batteries are dead - or if i leave them in overnight i get no pictures. if i use the flash it takes forever to charge it and then you are done. i take the same batteries out and put them into my nikon coolpix and can still take pictures.  too much stuff burning up the batteries to be able to take pics is my theory. the price seemed too good and so it was. camon has offered to repair it, but i am not sure it is worth spending postage money on.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: Canon SX160 is a fun camera. It does what is claimed. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the whole picture.The SX160 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 16 resolution (megapixels), and a big x16 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CCD-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.If you were to, say, take pictures of friends and family at an outdoor gathering, this camera is what you need. If you get ambitious, there will be stumbling blocks. Here is the camera's trait mix: It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 1600. That rating is lower than many others, but it is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. The camera gives you the option to control manually both the exposure and the focus. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 230,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The weight of the camera is 291 grams, which is light for its zoom.Overall, nice camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: A lotta bang for not a lotta bucks
Reviews.Author: Anna Eme
Reviews.Content: this camera is the best Christmas gift I could ever buy for myself. Coming from a camera noob, I bought Canon because my roommate is a film production major, and after telling her my ideal camera, she advised me to purchase this one. The pictures are very clear, and there are a lot of cool settings you can play with. It is a point and shoot, but I honestly feel like it's a DSLR at heart lol. No cons so far, everything is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Conon P.S. SX160
Reviews.Author: Eric The Red
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, more sophisticated than I ever imagined. I'll probably never be able to use all of it. No trouble downloading the software.

Reviews.Title: An Impressive Camera
Reviews.Author: John in Alex "John"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one because of reviewers on Amazon.com web site.  This one has AA batteries which you can find anywhere rather than the much more expensive Canon battery.  I use rechargeable batteries which is even better.  I like 16X optical zoom which is very impressive.  I have turned back to the lower level the 16mp size.  A great camera.

Reviews.Title: Okay deal I think
Reviews.Author: Janice Garcia
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great photos and has a tremendous zoom but the low factor is that we always have to be replacing the batteris all the time and you have to make sure you shut off the camera so the batteries won't die.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Many Features for A Lot Less.
Reviews.Author: William Scott Haskell
Reviews.Content: I first noticed this camera in Sam's Club for $149.00.  I looked it up on Amazon and it was available for a lot less.  I read the reviews and determined it was the camera for me.  I needed to replace my 3 megapix Olympic camera which I've had for many years and for which I paid over $200.00. This one has 16 megapix  and a 16X optical zoom.  It uses two AA batteries as opposed to the successor the SX-170 which uses a custom rechargeable battery.  It also serves as a camcorder with stereo audio inputs(I needed to replace my obsolete camcorder as well).  I've only had it a month but plan to use it extensively this summer.  The test pictures I took came out great.  I'd recommend it to anybody who needs a new camera.

Reviews.Title: canon poweshot
Reviews.Author: Kim Alexander
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!!!!  I've shown it to my photographer friends and they can't believe I got such a great deal!  They've shown me alot of different things to do with the camera...... I'm really pleased with it!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Sami
Reviews.Content: Everything about the camera is amazing, and I love and will be using it for a long while. I would totally reccomend it

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Dustin Ingeman
Reviews.Content: Camera worked for 3 months before no longer powering on. Called Canon and received a replacement 3 weeks later. The replacement lasted 2 days before the shutter stopped working. Going to try and get my money back.

Reviews.Title: AA Batteries
Reviews.Author: Carol Welch
Reviews.Content: I had this camera before but it did not survive a fall on to a marble floor.  It took excellent photos.  It uses AA batteries which I find more user friendly than those that have to be recharged on a regular basis.  I only wish there was a camera with this that also featured  the alternate viewer to the screen which is always hard to see in the sun.

Reviews.Title: I Think Mine is Defective
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: On auto and every shot is blurry and the color and quality is terrible. The autofocus is not working properly nor is face detection. I did my homework, all the other reviews are great, just got a dud. No longer a Canon customer.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Francis
Reviews.Content: The price for the camera was great, especially considering how great it was.I bought this canon for my trip to Rome, and it took perfect pictures.Pros:- Being able to switch out the batteries when they died- Small enough to be able to whip it out for a quick picture - not like those monster $350+ cameras- Incredible zoom. The Pope did his weekly Wednesday blessing from a window in the Vatican, he was so high and so far away, I could barley see him. So I took my camera out, zoomed in, and watched him from there. The pictures of him came out great too.- The camera did pretty well with motion shots. A lot of the time I was on top of one of those double-decker buses, and I could still take great pictures of sculptures we passed by.Cons:- did very poorly with nighttime shots / awkward lighting shots. Rome looks beautiful at night, but the camera just couldn't adjust. It has a nice manual mode, where you can adjust the shutter and aperture yourself, but I guess I just couldn't get it right. it also did poorly when I was at the vatican museum, the way the light was.hope this helps. overall a great camera

Reviews.Title: Very useful pocket sized camera
Reviews.Author: Abe Baldwin "Abe"
Reviews.Content: Very useful. Does use battery fairly quickly ..Just carry extra. Lens shutter like protector  is exposed to pocket grit and grime. Needs clean camera bag or lens cap to protect this delicate mechanism.

Reviews.Title: Nice photos
Reviews.Author: ronnie beard
Reviews.Content: After going to several camera shops i found this camera on the internet. The camera was cheaper and exceeded all my expectations. The photos are very clear and the camera was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Stepp
Reviews.Content: It took a long time to get my mom from roll film to digital.  I first bought this camera for her because it was easy, took great pictures and took double A batteries.  I know still a little old fashioned, but I bought the rechargeable kind with the recharger and she can take it anywhere and not have to worry.  After several years and thousands ( and believe me she loves her pictures)  and a few drops of the camera here and there, the pictures started getting a line in them.  We search high and low for another camera with at least the same zoom and mp AND the double A batteries.  ( They just don't make them any more.)  So I can't tell you how happy I was when I saw that Amazon had this camera!!!  She has shots of the moon with this camera that you can even see the shadows of the craters and very detailed pictures of her birds and squirrels that are just amazing......  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Competes with camera's up too 199$ Very good Camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: LifeCast
Reviews.Content: Five stars, probably best in the sub $100 category maybe even better than most in the sub $150-175 for general snap shots. I saw it at Walmart for $99 dollars.This camera is a very good camera and by the amount of reviews and the star rating you probably already know that. This one is discontinued now but you can still find it. Grab it while you can, even if you have more expensive cameras, this can be the one you can throw in a backpack, your car, work truck and not worry about.

Reviews.Title: SX camera always a good choice
Reviews.Author: Brad Anderson
Reviews.Content: I've owned a number of Canon point and shoot cameras as well as some other brands. My favorite was the Canon SX110 which I bought in 2008. The best results from a point and shoot camera that I ever owned. Purchased a Canon SX210is which has a higher resolution and a stronger zoom. While more compact than the SX110 series it does not take nearly the quality of pictures. Also, I liked the 2 AA battery set-up of the SX110. The SX160 is nearly identical to the old SX110 so I thought I would by it since Canon deleted the AA battery set up in the newest model. Sure there are smaller point and shoot cameras with more features out there but this take the best pictures of any I've come across short of a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: kghyde38
Reviews.Content: Have only had this camera for a few weeks. Took some shots over Christmas. The pictures turned out beautiful. The camera is slow though as far as taking pics and recharging flash. For the price its a good camera though.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Collins
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera!  We bought this in replacement of an older model that was dropped (sx120is).  We went with this model because it still used "AA" batteries and not a special battery as the newer models use (sx170is).  This camera is very easy to use right out of the box with the "auto" setting.  Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Ronald Goff
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas and she absolutely loves the camera. It is simple enough to operate yet it has enough gadgets to keep her happy. It takes wonderful pictures. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Don L. Binder
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures and video, and was easy to learn how to use the basic features.  Love that 16 to 1 zoom, IF I hold the camera more steady.  Be aware that some of the largest files on your harddrive will be those 720p videos if you take long ones.  I did reduce the picture res to 8mp, as that's already much better than my last camera, and I don't do poster prints.  Battery life with Eneloops was outstanding, 2 weeks on one set during our Niagara and Pennsylvania trip!  And I took a couple of hundred pics and vids.  The Transcend 16GB Class 10 card keeps me shooting as rapidly as I need to shoot.

Reviews.Title: THIS MODEL BETTER THAN THE NEW MODEL
Reviews.Author: SC GIRL "EX-NYC"
Reviews.Content: I don't own the new model but I know that all of the specs of the old model and the new model are the same except one important aspect that was important to me. This model uses AA batteries. The newer model (the SX 170) uses a proprietary rechargeable lithium battery that costs $46. While shopping for a small point-and-shoot camera with a nice long zoom range, I spent days comparing prices, mega pixels, zoom lenses, and the cost for needed accessories. I like the Powershot SX in this group because even though it is small and light weight, it still has a "handle" making it easier to hold on to.In my shopping though, I was dismayed to realize that even the least expensive cameras in the range I was considering all but one used proprietary batteries. This particular model (the SX 160)  was not actually being listed by some vendors since the newer model was released (the SX 170). I was reading on Amazon, an extensive 3 star review by John Sturgeon of the SX 170 and in it he talks about the battery issue.He pointed out that if you use generic rechargeable batteries ($20) and your camera fails, your warranty is void for using the cheaper generic. I personally would never go out on an excursion on vacation without an extra battery. So you are paying something like $120 for a camera that costs you $46 plus tax and shipping so that you have a backup. This is similar to buying a printer for $200 only to find out later you are going to have to spend $90 to replace the ink cartridges ONE TIME.I had already had the experience of trying to find a camera that would use AA's and only found one which I think had a man zoom to something like the equivalent of 148 MM. After I read that review I started hunting for vendors where I could get the SX 160. I bought one for a friend for Christmas and one for me.This is my backup camera. I don't know if the color clarity meets my expectations yet. It is winter and the colors in the bushes, trees and lawns are pretty blah right now. I have tried to take pics of a Cardinal but I have to do that through a window since he is quite touchy and won't hang around even if I am too visible to him through the glass so that really cuts down on the quality of the photo.I think it is worth it's price because of the battery issue alone! The SX 170 right now is lower than the price I paid for this lower model. I strongly suggest using the Energizer Ultimate Lithium AA batteries. I currently use the non-rechargeable and they cost around $16 for a pkg of 8. For 1/3 the cost of 1 proprietary battery, you can buy 12 pairs of these batteries that Energizer guarantees will not damage your equipment. The rechargeable version of these batteries has recently been introduced but I haven't used them. Personally I would stress out when on vacation having to recharge batteries the end of each day and making sure you carried extra.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but Needs Stronger Batteries
Reviews.Author: The Cat
Reviews.Content: I'm changing my original review because I've gotten to use the camera more.____________________________________If you want a small camera to slip in and out of a purse, this is not for you. The SX 160 is a little bulky (which I don't mind), but that is probably because of the large lens. I'm not kidding, this is twice as thick as my Nikon Coolpix S3000, there is a grip on the side, which is helpful for one handed shots. The camera is a little heavy, but it's not too bad. You can decide which side to put the hand strap on because there are two holes for them.The flash does not pop up automatically. The camera tells you on the screen to pop up the flash. You have to press a little button. Once again, I don't mind.The screen is large and easy to read off of. The buttons are a good size, too. I like the Recording button that instantly starts shooting the video. That's very helpful, because there is a wheel on top that you use to change modes, which takes some time.Now for the image quality:The images are pretty good, even in bad lighting. The scenes are a little hard to find and the shutter speed may be unpredictable. It depends on what mode you are on. I find that the quickest shutter speed is on the low light mode.Like I said, the shutter speed can be random. It changes with every scene option, and you have almost no choice on changing it. There are a few scenes that have a quick speed that are amazing, though. When it is in a fast mode, the picture taken very quickly.The image quality is fantastic, on the camera screen and the computer screen. Most pictures aren't blurry, unless the shutter is really slow. The pictures turn out vivid and sharp.There are SO MANY MODES on this camera, and they're a little hard to find. It's not the most user friendly, but it's not that bad. I'm not an expert photographer or anything and I think I know the camera pretty well.The 16x zoom on this camera is fantastic. The images stay pretty clear as you zoom out more. I could zoom into a person's eye from across the room.I haven't played a lot with the video, but I've tried it out and I can hardly hear it. I think it's just because I have no idea how to turn the volume up.Now, the batteries. I had to.change the batteries twice, I think, the day I got this. I will admit that I was playing around for a while and taking lots of pictures, but still, it was ridiculous. This camera just needs strong batteries.Here's a list of PROS and CONS as a conclusion.PROS:-Great picture quality-Easy to hold-Good in low light-Good shutter speed (on certain modes)-Fantastic zoom-Lots of image options-Flash power can be changedCONS:-A little bulky-Some modes have awful shutter speeds-Needs stronger batteries-Takes some exploring to find featuresOverall a great camera and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but too bulky
Reviews.Author: Eusebius
Reviews.Content: First, let me tell you I like this camera and but I'm sending it back to Amazon. I was looking for a light, simple automatic p&s; that I could stick in my pocket and take with me into the field where I record evidence of animal activity. The camera I need has to have AA batteries for power (there are no rechargers in the field and a $35 spare battery is no fun for me) and it's easier to pack a couple of spare AAs in my pocket. The SX-160 seemed to be the one!Comparing it to other small point and shoot cameras the problem is that it's just a little too bulky. It weighs in at 11 ounces (the A1100 is 7 ounces) and the lens barrel/back gives it a depth of about 1.75 inches. This is not a pocket camera. It is sort of intermediate to a digital SLR and a pocket point & shoot. All that being said, here what's good about this camera:The pictures are very good. When testing, I never failed to take at least an acceptable photo.The camera can be set to do ISO tracking, making it easier pick a detail to focus on.You can see what the final photo will actually look like with `exposure live view'There is a host of settings and special effectsLag time between shots is very short (except when using the flash)32x optical zoom and 64x(!) digital zoomHere's what what the problems are:The flash is not wholly automatic. If you need a flash, a message pops up on the screen telling you to pop up the flashThe flash has a long recharge time.It eats batteries quicker than other cameras in this class.It's not a pocket camera. It won't fit in a shirt pocket and is too bulky for a jacket  pocket.It really is a pretty good camera but I will settle for the newer Canon A1400.

Reviews.Title: love my canon
Reviews.Author: ang nc
Reviews.Content: this baby takes beautiful photos . delivery was fast and the price was right . it took me some time to get used to seting the picture up with the screen as it does not have a view finder . easy to use , even with all the functions .

Reviews.Title: Great Zoom
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with a fantastic zoom feature.  Like all Cannons it runs very well.  It does go thru batteries however.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Charlotte A. Vorron
Reviews.Content: Bought this because it seem to be simple enough for a novice (me) to operate and didn't break the bank.Hope to use it on an upcoming cruise.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX160 IS
Reviews.Author: danch
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price! I had an SX130IS and the 160 has much better zoom capability! Great photo quality.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: pegto
Reviews.Content: super fast service and what a great camera, you can take pictures that look professional. give it a try you will love it

Reviews.Title: Just what I Wanted ~Fast Shipping
Reviews.Author: Lilly Rose "Babs"
Reviews.Content: Just what I Wanted ~ This was a replacement to an older version & it has real batteries that you can change.You can be away from electricity and take pics to your hearts content. Excellent product for those quick shots.

Reviews.Title: Great camera especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Richard Ramsay
Reviews.Content: This camera, though not expensive, has many qualities found on more expensive cameras.  This is one of several Canon cameras I have had.

Reviews.Title: Love my Canon SX160!
Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera for anyone that has only used the point and shoot models with low zoom. Instead of jumping into a fancy $500 model, try this one first. It has lots of shooting options, most of which I don't use but they are easy to change from one to another. Camera is easy to operate and you can hold it steady enough at full 16x zoom to take a clear pic with a little practice.Cons: Moving subjects are hard to photograph without blurriness.I've not been able to take good photos in low light when outside.The zoom uses a lot of power and will drain your batteries quickly. Camera should have been designed to use 4 AA batteries.Over all, I am VERY happy with this camera and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: A Gift for our daughter1
Reviews.Author: Matt Freeman
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as a gift for our youngest daughter. She found it easy to use and is now taking a beginner camera class. This camera has many of the same features as our much more expensive Cannon Rebel camera!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Cathycat
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I bought, it makes great pictures. I am not a photographer, so I really appreciated to be able to use it quite easily.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Hasty "DFW Resident"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my wife. She goes through a camera every two years. Canons have been great. The view screen resolution could be better. So far wife is very pleased with camera.

Reviews.Title: great Canon
Reviews.Author: Chris Dinnocenzo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic zoom and close ups. Light and accepts rechargeable alkaline batteries. I would reccommend to any photo enthusiast just starting out.

Reviews.Title: Love the sx160 camera !!
Reviews.Author: Floyd Eash
Reviews.Content: The canon powershot sx160 takes great pictures !! Would be nice if it had a battery pack. but we love the camera!!

Reviews.Title: Not my 1st Canon product.
Reviews.Author: Don N.
Reviews.Content: I am not a new comer to the Canon family so when I wanted a small light weight camera I looked to Canon and found the Powershot SX160. I have a Powershot Pro-1 and I have had great pictures from it but I wanted a camera with a higher resolution and a more or less point and shoot format. The SX 160 will be my 6th Canon camera in the last 10 years and I can't say enough about the construction and ease of use of the cameras. I like the improved stableization feature of the camera as well as the 16X optical zoom. I look forward to many years of satisfactory picture taking with this camera. Over the past 10 years I have bought Canon printers, scanners, and of course Digital cameras and I can't say enough good things about Canon and their products and their professional attitude in supporting their products. Keep up the good work Canon.

Reviews.Title: Nice size camera - fits in my fanny pack
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: This camera takes terrific photos of people and scenery.  My only objection is not being able to see what I'm shooting in bright sun light and wish the cameras with eye pieces weren't so heavy and cumbersome.  And I love having a different colored camera so it doesn't get picked up by someone else by mistake when I'm on a trip.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: abdulhadi
Reviews.Content: Very good cameraOne of the best camerasGood zoom  I like itI enjoyed the cameraThank you all

Reviews.Title: Read the other reviews - they give all the information you want
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou Cochrane
Reviews.Content: I hate buying cameras.  Seems like I spend the most time researching cameras and can never come up with the perfect camera for what I want for the price I want to pay.This is a great little camera.  If there's anything negative, it's how long it takes before I can take the next picture.  My other digital camera took a little while, but this one is slow.  There is an option where you can take a lot of pictures in a row but I haven't tried that except when I first read the directions.  I will give that a try.I bought this to replace our camera when we lost the case and charger.  This one uses AA batteries.  So far the battery life doesn't seem too bad on regular AA batteries.  I carry two sets in the case.  I bought it to use on our second Yellowstone trip this year and it was great.  Batteries lasted for the whole 7 days trip.  It took some really nice movies and pictures.I'm happy with the camera and hope I can go several years before I have to research another camera online!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Perry
Reviews.Content: Use it for two weeks in Europe, batteries seem to go fast......I am not going o fill the page.... that's all folks

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Wolfe
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to Philmont Scout Reservation and I loved it. I got so many great photos. The zoom is great and I like the different settings. A great camera

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Becky Pipher
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera expecting a good camera, but was pleasantly surprised to find an excellent camera.  My pictures are much clearer and focused.

Reviews.Title: long delay between photos
Reviews.Author: OSU "OSU"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera based on the great reviews on Amazon but am returning it because there is a very long delay between photos and the flash takes a long time to recharge.  I have kids and don't always want to wait 4-5 seconds between photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Karen J.
Reviews.Content: Camera was packaged with care it arrived on time and in great condition. Excellent camera for the price. You can move and it still takes a clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX160 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Nanachehaw "SkyFlyer"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. Compact with all the features of a more expensive model.  Looking forward to more exciting pics  in future.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Mommy to 3 Boys
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for someone like me. I have the regular canon DSLR, but we were taking a trip to an amusement park and didn't want to lug around all the stuff for it. So looking through I purchased this camera, and was so happy I did. I love the automatic scene predictor it has, action shots came out perfect to even the close up shots without being blurry. This camera has everything you can imagine. Each picture I took came out perfect, and all I had to to was a simple point and shoot. I can honestly say this camera has now become my quick go to camera for everything.The only downside to this camera is that is seems a little flimsy. It doesn't feel like the outer covering is very sturdy. This should not be just tossed in a purse like some cameras can. I recommend a case when not in use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for a point & shoot
Reviews.Author: MARNI
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my granddaughter for a 17th birthday gift. Since then she has taken several hundred pic. with it over a wide variety of subjects from portrait  types to sunset and ocean scenes with, in my opinion, no less than fantastic results. I use a canon rebel my self and I have to say some of her pic's. are better than mine. Of course that could be due to the operator also.Update 9-20-2013;Just had some 16X20 enlargements made from my granddaughter's pics. Incredible! The detail ,clarity and quality is amazing at this size. One, a close up of a tiger at full body side view, you can see the individual hairs are crisp and a fly on it's back is in amazing detail! If it weren't for the annoying shutter lag that all digital non-SLR cameras have I would be buying one for myself. The ability of the camera to adjust for the lighting for beach sunsets is amazing. I could not get better natural looking results with photoshop.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for my needs
Reviews.Author: Jody Catanzarite
Reviews.Content: Easy to pack for hiking and takes awesome pictures.  The zoom does a very good job for a "pack around" camera.

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: J. Ellis "tr granny"
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot SX160 IS is a great little camera. Easy to use and quality photos. I bought two for my granddaughters and they love them.

Reviews.Title: Nice upgrade
Reviews.Author: J. LATOURRETTE
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use. Does a nice job with photos of moving subjects, ie my border collie. Nice upgrade from the A1200.

Reviews.Title: Am enjoying this camera
Reviews.Author: GregCV
Reviews.Content: This purchase was a step up for me from the simple little box digital camera, and I have learned it is easier to use and much more versatile than what I was using B4.  Also the pics are better quality.  This purchase was a "win" for me, and I am glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: S. Moncur
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace another Canon Powershot that got broken accidentally.  I am very impressed with this camera!  It has so many features I have not even really started to "learn" all of them yet!  The owners manual, is very lengthy and is only available on line, so be sure to have paper to print it out.  It does come with a  30 page manual, but it barely touches on the features of this little gem.

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos by a non-photographer
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 15 year old to use in her photography class.  We are a Canon family so while she looked at other brands, we all felt 'safer' sticking with a Canon.  (I had bought a water-resistant Fuji last year and think the photos turn out so-so).  She needs to be able to change the various settings (shutter speeds, lighting) and her point-and-shoot pink camera wasn't cutting it.  She loves this camera and is able to do more with her photography class assignments.This past weekend, I seemed to misplace my own Canon camera and wanted to take photos at her dance competition so I borrowed her camera (she was dancing, she didn't need it).  Luckily, I carry a big ol' handbag as the camera, while lightweight thanks to the plastic case, is rather large.  I loved that there's a button specifically to turn on the flash as flash photography isn't allowed.  On my own misplaced camera, you have to go to a couple of clicks to turn it off.I took photos from about 100 feet away, in a darkened room, of her dancing on stage.  On my camera, the photos would have turned out blurry and dark - basically un-usable.  With her Canon, I got great photos and I was using the AUTO setting.  I'm sure I could have captured the moving dancers better if I selected one of the 32 settings or even better went into manual mode.Now I'm looking for a replacement camera for myself since I can't find mine and since the camera technology has obviously improved.So why 4 stars and why am I not buying this one?  I would like something smaller that 1) I could keep in my jean pocket or a jacket pocket; 2) I don't need all those manual stop features as I don't know how to use them and, 3) this camera takes 2 AA-batteries.  I prefer rechargeable ones.  We did overcome the latter objection thanks to another review that recommended Sony Eneloops which are rechargeable batteries.

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot sx160 is
Reviews.Author: Donald  Willitts
Reviews.Content: This camera is larger than I thought it would be a hard to articulate in my wifes small handsthe focus takes a long time to clear and give you a sence of what you are about to take a picture of.We have only had it fo a few weeks and I am hopeing it will grow on us but so far I am not impressed

Reviews.Title: I'll keep my SX130-IS.
Reviews.Author: F. Lamaestra
Reviews.Content: I was all excited about getting the new Cannon SX160-IS during Black Friday. I was finally able to put the camera through its paces during CES to discover some issues:-Camera shutter button is too sensitive, looks like a general issue, not just mine. Lots of accidental shots.-Video capture will show flicker when near CFL lights. My other Cannon does not do this.-Start-up and usage speeds are about the same as the SX130-IS.-Images/Video shows more grain than SX130-IS at same ISO/Resolution.The only real improvement is the additional zoom and the slight increase in zoom speed/reaction.  The guy at staples let me return the camera, even after two months. I was very thankful.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: John A. Pendleton
Reviews.Content: I love the smaller size, also love it because you can put the date on your photoes, great price also

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Mafe
Reviews.Content: me  llego bien , buen articulo, buen vendedor, me llego a tiempo, por ahora todo esta bien, lo compraria de nuevo

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot review
Reviews.Author: Rowdy Yates
Reviews.Content: I purshased a Canon Powershot when they were first released.  The camera ran through batteries like a child in a candy shop.  I was unrelieable and the pictures were substandard.  Finally, the camera failed to turn on, for no reason!!  I contacted Canon and they refused to back their product!!  Heck, they couldn't even fix the problem.  I will NEVER do business with Canon because they failed to back a faulty produce.  VERY POOR business practice combine with an expensive piece of camera garbage - cuz that's where my camera went after two years of frusterating use!

Reviews.Title: Worst low light photos
Reviews.Author: Satyajit
Reviews.Content: After reading all great reviews I was convinced and purchased this camera. I tested it for 10 days and then returned. This camera has worst low light photos. photos taken inside room are blurred.  Even when inside room sufficient day light, this camera need flash else you will get worst quality photo. Do not purchase if you are looking for camera for using inside home family events like birthdays or home functions it is useless for low light photos. Outside photos are nice.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Little Gem
Reviews.Author: Peter D.
Reviews.Content: Hello Everyone,First off to those who wish to post a review you NEED to actually use the Camera not read other reviews then post a bogus review.  This camera was purchased at a store and I have now had it for a little less than a week.  Now for a sub $200 camera this is an amazing little gem. Play around with all the settings, make a slide show like did and post it to youtube like I did if you look under this camera its title will state Canon SX160 slide show.  The macro settings are great, the zoom can actually be aided up to 64x through the digital assistance.The battery life is very short if you use the conventional AA batteries however if you pick up a charging unit the life will excel far greater than the regular ones.  The Macro setting on this little camera is great, for what you get and pay, remember this is an affordable budget camera and point and shoot.Play around with the settings, like I have and you will find a host of features that this camera offers. There is a (slow motion) feature on the video program in (playback mode) that is so cool. I am no expert I am no Pro and I am no certified photographer however I am inquisitive enough to explore the options this camera has to offer.The Intelligent Auto setting is for the (lazy people) play around with the Manual (M) setting or program (P) setting and venture into other areas for higher quality photos.The Image Stabilization on this little fellow is awesome and the video is only 720HD not 1080HD and there is a vast difference with the two qualities.  If you are taking videos of something and need maximum zoom with digital assist you will need either a Monopod, tripod or sturdy base mount for no vibrations period.  Play around with the ISO range it is pretty wide from 100-1600 now that is awesome for a small inexpensive camera such as the Canon SX160 ISI highly recommend getting a screen protector even though it may alter the clarity somewhat however if you drop it and scratch the LCD well it is now compromised.16 X Optical Zoom scores a 10 not a 5 for the Digital assist is astonishing in this tiny camera wow (64x max with digital)16 Mp quality is good not great720HD video is good for the moneyFlash works well enoughPrograms on camera are greatEase of use is wonderful once you know what you are doing(no microphone adjust) this is a shame unless it is on here and I just cannot find it.Meaty camera that has some weight not feeling like it will blow away in the windImage Stabilization is wonderful, impressive on a camera so smallYes I would highly recommend this to another !!

Reviews.Title: The Best Point And Shoot of the Market
Reviews.Author: Rochelle D. Adkins "Froggy Bottoms"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my Nikon point and shoot went on the fritz.  I went back to the Canon because they take great concert pictures.  Not only does this camera work great in dim lighting but it has great zoom abilities.  That makes it the perfect camera for rock concerts.  The camera also stabilizes your shot even if your hands shake a little.  There are no bad pictures with this camera!The camera uses regular batteries which I prefer because charging a battery slows you down.  If you're on the go, stock up on some batteries and go.  No worries about having to plug the battery in and wait until you have a full charge to shoot.Even better, the price is super reasonable.  You cannot get a name brand camera for this price anywhere!

Reviews.Title: More pros than cons
Reviews.Author: M. L. Carter "ML Carter"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera for a number of reasons. It's light weight, the pictures are crisp, and color is great. Considering I started out using digital cameras when they had a floppy disk, today's digital cameras are awesome. Cons, it takes a long time (30 sec.) to charge the flash in between pictures. Now, maybe I need to learn how to use the flash in a more efficient manner?? Even for this annoyance, the pictures I take in the slightly dark school gym with this camera defiantly come out better than with any other camera.Price was good as well. And, it works on zoom-in mode better than any other I've used--no fuzziness.So I just need to be patient or learn how to use the flash better.

Reviews.Title: Slow, but love it anyway
Reviews.Author: Becca
Reviews.Content: This camera is true to the reviews--it is slow and not suitable for action shots. It takes a LONG time to reset for next shot, especially if using the flash.  Otherwise, no complaints.  Very easy to use, zoom is exceptionally clear, pictures are perfect.  I love the red color, it's not too big but still feels like a camera and not a phone in my hand.  Buy it...unless you are a speed junkie, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Terry Dote
Reviews.Content: I have had several old style 35 MM SLR's, (See Through the Lens) and a point and shoot.  This seems to me to be a good combination of the two.  While is is not an SLR, it offers many very user friendly features.  The zoom is excellent, and the ease of use simple.

Reviews.Title: Takes too long for flash to set
Reviews.Author: Heather Henderson
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures.  The downfall is it takes too long for the flash to reset.  The candid photo shot is missed.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: joyful
Reviews.Content: I have been really enjoying my new canon, I had an old PowerShot, and it was good, but now my photo's are more professional. With the traveling I do and the hiking photo's its a great camera. I love the AA batteries because no matter where I travel I can get batteries and use the camera. The zoom ad features are wonderful Great camera, great seller.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to love it
Reviews.Author: FS
Reviews.Content: I've been a loyal Canon user for over twenty years. I have owned all the previous models in this line SX100, SX110, SX120, SX130, SX150 and now this SX160. I went to use this camera for the first time this past weekend and after the second picture I took it came up with a lens error. The lens would not retract at all. Even after removing the batteries. Finally the next day it retracted. I have never had a problem with the previous models so I'm not sure it I got a lemon. The few pictures I did take indoors were grainy and out of focus. It seems like the beginning cameras in this line were way better than the latest models. This was my go to camera for concerts, not anymore. Sad because now I have to find another model I like better. The G15 takes amazing pictures in low light but it only has a 5x zoom. I have the T4i too but think my T1i just as well if not better. Hopefully Canon can fix these issues because I don't want to switch brands.

Reviews.Title: Misleading white balance and cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Tania Lee "applemanju"
Reviews.Content: I loved the look of this camera and also wanted a small camera that had manual settings.The white balance on the monitor is completely different than on the computer. I was taking interior shots and played with the white balance and exposure until I got a nice bright shot (if you over expose a little indoors, white walls can appear less dingy). Once I loaded my card in, the shots were filled with brown tones, looked nothing like it did on the monitor.The little trap door for the batteries is hard to close, it's very awkward, I feel like it's going to break at anytime.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX160 IS 16.0 Digital Camera with 16x Wide-Angle
Reviews.Author: P. Lock
Reviews.Content: The pictures it takes are okay, but you have to wait for the flash to recharge so you miss shots. Plus if you need flash, it has to tell you to open the flash to use it; it's not automatic, at least I haven't been able to figure out how to change settings if this shouldn't be the case

Reviews.Title: No kids and animal setting!
Reviews.Author: Patty
Reviews.Content: With this camera there is a big chance the image of your kids will be blurry. I've been using the auto setting since there is no kids and pets setting. Not too happy.

Reviews.Title: High Pixel Count High Mag Zoom
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Hailey "haileymon"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son for Christmas. He needed something besides his GoPro or the Big ole Canon 30D and 60D. Don't get me wrong, the GoPRo is awesome. Got one. But if you're runnin' and gunnin' or need to zoom in, well with the GoPro you're pretty much hosed. And if you need to go bicycle around town or cross country you need something small and lightweight. Something reasonably rugged with a high quality image and whistles and bells to enhance your creativity. I carry an SX200 everywhere I go. I'm a big Canon fan, been shooting Canon since 1970 but to be fair, I looked at the other players. I went for the Canon. 16MP, 16X, EOS, Digic4, 720p,3"screen, AA batteries.
