Was $169, I think, (now $149) Its not build like a 5D but its small, lightweight and powerful. Be careful where you aim it.

Reviews.Title: it is just an ordinary compact camera, with many extras ...
Reviews.Author: confused
Reviews.Content: This camera has only a 1/2.3" CCD Sensor (6.17mm x 4.55mm). We've all seen dodgy images from high mega pixel cameras and know that after a point, mega pixels don't matter for most people – a 16 MP compact isn't ever going to be as good as a 12 MP Full Frame DSLR. What does matter is sensor size!The cameras sensor sizes are:1/3.2"(4.54 x 3.42mm)1/2.3"(6.17 x 4.55mm)1/1.7"(7.60 X 5.70mm)2/3"  (8.80 X 6.60mm)1/1.2"(10.67x 8.0mm)Micro Four Thirds 4/3"(17.30x13mm)1" (12.8X9.60mm)1.5"(18.70X14.00mm)APS-c (Canon) 22.20X14.8mmAPS-C 23.60x15.60mmAPS-H 27.9 x 18.6mmFull Frame 36.00 x 24.00 mmHigher-end Compacts – With demand growing and the price of producing larger sensors falling, there are a growing number of higher-end compact cameras with larger sensors. For example the Fuji film X20 has a 2/3-inch (8.8 x 6.6 mm) sensor Price: $445.50, while the Sony RX100 has an even bigger 1-inch sensor (12.8 x 9.6 mm). Price: $548.00. The Canon G1 X even boasts a 1.5-inch sensor (18.7 x 14 mm) Price: $579.00.So you get what you pay. If you want to take crude pictures then you go for Cameras sensor size 1/3.2" or1/2.3" without extras at around $100. If you needs more decent pictures, and not to discredit yourself on Face book then you go for around 1"(12.80x9.60mm). Don't be fooled by mega pixles. This is an illusion and deception. Concentrate at lenses quality, CCD sensor size and, Digital Image Processor.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: edward
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth every dollar! cheap and its awsome!! some of my friends didnt believe i took a picture of my dogs they thought i posted it from google it was really funny to me this camera can zoom in so far!!! and take a clear shot i can take far away pictures and video!! ive had rechargable batteries in this camera for 3 days now with a good amount of use and the batteries r still going strong im 19 nd im a beginer so ive been taking lots of pictures and videos and i love this camera everyone compliments my pictures!12-12-13If anything fails ill update and let everyone know!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: D. Jarvis "Ex-Pat Canuck"
Reviews.Content: I have been disappointed with other point and shoot cameras in this price range. This one has yet to let me down.Pros:Easy to usePortableGreat zoomGood variety of settings and effectsUses AA batteriesCons:A bit heavy for its sizeFlash doesn't automatically come up.Color not as vibrant as DSLRUses AA batteriesOverall a super deal for the price. I am happy.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the non-professional
Reviews.Author: J. Gant "Texaschick"
Reviews.Content: Loved being able to get this camera in red!!  Easy to use with easy to read icons.  Still learning the features....much more than I will ever need!

Reviews.Title: Carry a ton of batteries.
Reviews.Author: Frank DeSantis
Reviews.Content: I read that review about batteries and thought how bad could it be?Bad.It goes through batteries after a few hours of use.I use the camera a lot throughout a day and the two AA batteries doesn't seem much to replace, but every couple days under heavy usage. It's a bit much.Now I carry around 4 batteries with me all the time. Kind of defeats the purpose of lightweight point and shoot.Hate to think how many batteries I would need if I were to go backpacking a few days with it.Bummer because the camera itself isn't too shabby, I like.I'll pay more attention to reviews about battery life next time.

Reviews.Title: Step in the wrong direction
Reviews.Author: Blue Floyds "Blue"
Reviews.Content: I had the SX110 and it is wonderful, nice low light pics, fast and responsive AF and great auto WB with resulting great pics.The SX160 is worse in every aspect. No matter the 16 mega pixel processor, this actually is a point against it with extra noise all over. And really 16x zoom is not much a jump from 9x (when 30x zoom is available on other models/brands).All in all it was a disappointment compared to my old SX110.Good thing I bought it cheap on a deal, $132, or else I will be fuming!!

Reviews.Title: No pocket users manual; eats batteries
Reviews.Author: Geoff
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this  camera yesterday. As with all cameras, there are several buttons, that have different functions in different modes. This camera only comes with the shortest, least informative "quick start guide", not a pocket users manual. It does come with a disk, of which you can print out the over 200 pages of 8.5x11 . But how inconvenient is that to use, when you're away from home, trying to shoot, and figure out all of the buttons, and modes? Additionally, while I sat at my computer, reading (scrolling page after page)and trying to figure out how to operate the SX160 IS, the low battery indicator light, started to flash within 45 minutes! Others reviewers have already commented, on this camera's thirst for batteries. I called Canon, requesting a pocket manual. I was told (politely) that Canon no longer printed users manuals, and that they would send me the 8.5x11 printed manual. I am returning this camera to Amazon today, I am very disappointed in Canon's decision not to print a pocket sized manual. How much would that cost them?

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Kevind
Reviews.Content: Although I've been a Canon fan and like cameras that use AA batteries, this camera took too long to get ready for the next photo, and didn't do well in low lighting. I'm a casual picture taker, just want to point and shoot, but this camera was too slow for me.  I returned it and purchased a Fujifilm Finepix 660 EXR and am real happy with it.  Even though it doesn't use AA's it takes a lot of photos on one charge of the battery.  Just right for me!

Reviews.Title: Not  what was expected
Reviews.Author: Dianne Reissman
Reviews.Content: Am not able to go from photo to photo flash has to recharge between each photo : (Seems to really go through battery power always seems to have red battery flashing for recharge.I had the Canon Power Shot SX 120 IS and really liked it. I expected  better from this one. unhappy with purchase

Reviews.Title: I
Reviews.Author: Karen Durrett
Reviews.Content: I like the camera but I am noticing I go through batteries like crazy!!!Takes good pictures though! Maybe lithium batteries.

Reviews.Title: Had a blast
Reviews.Author: Chrisy Aponte
Reviews.Content: Had a blast on Christmas taking pictures so much to learn about though but easy to use and also got the portable Canon photo printer from amazon and love love love that too

Reviews.Title: Somewhat Disappointing
Reviews.Author: joseph
Reviews.Content: Bought it because it appeared to be a lot of camera for the money. However, I was somewhat disappointed by its performance. My main complaint is that it takes a very long time to recover between pictures - especially when using the flash - you'll miss a lot of good shots waiting for it to reload - and it gobbles up AA batteries.  In addition, the zoom control is way too extreme - it's either fully engaged or not - makes it very difficult to zoom in or out just a little more or less - so after 30 seconds of trying to get it to stop in the right spot you finally just give up and take the picture wherever it stopped last - frustrating.  In reality, you don't really need this much zoom in a little camera like this - you'll see what I mean if you buy it.  However, it does take a nice picture and the wide-angle lens makes a huge difference - no problem getting entire rooms or landscapes in the picture. And one last thing - it's really not a "pocket" camera - it is small - but not that small.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: Very Good Quality Camera. The pictures came out clear and there is no problems with the camera. I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: great model ...
Reviews.Author: ZIGGY
Reviews.Content: camera  come on time , I  bought this  model  year ago , and  now I  bought for  my  mom... is  easy to use and  taking  good pictures...

Reviews.Title: What a fun camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Short
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to replace a smaller one with fewer pixels and not as good a zoom.  We are very pleased wtih the photos this camera has produced, and look forward to using it for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Pamela Gower
Reviews.Content: Small enough to carry in purse and takes great pics I love it. But goes through double A batteries like crazy

Reviews.Title: A good value.
Reviews.Author: becky
Reviews.Content: My third camera of this type. Just a newer version. Very pleased with the performance. The flash is slow to charge.

Reviews.Title: "Old Model?"  Not so!
Reviews.Author: ADK-PAPA "Bill"
Reviews.Content: This model is state of the art.  The difference to the SX170 is the chargeable battery.  Otherwise same functions across the board.  This is a good replacement for my Canon Power Shot A590 which I have had for years until the dial fell off last month.

Reviews.Title: Just right
Reviews.Author: JCW "wwjd"
Reviews.Content: Needed a small and dependable camera that still used AA batteries for living/traveling in a third world country.  Though I have a powerful phone camera, I could not trust others with it as I had to be in many of the shots.  This is absolutely what was needed. VERY happy with this; easy to use; great colors; great zoom and small enough to put in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Very, very Happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: James C. Glenn
Reviews.Content: Camera easy to use and has very good zoom.  Autofocus is great.  I used camera on trip to Smoky Mountains last Sept. and got tons of fantastic pics.  Would recommend this camera to anyone starting out in digital photography.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted-easy to use-great pictures
Reviews.Author: larry p.
Reviews.Content: Works to my expectations-light weight, easy to use, great pictures for my on-line picture purposes.I don't need a big expensive camera with all sorts of bells & whistles. This does fine.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: debbiejo
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's easy to use, takes great pictures, and I like the fact that it takes batteries so I am always ready. A very good choice.

Reviews.Title: Great still camera, great "camcorder".
Reviews.Author: JohnnyCaps "Video Junkie"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures.  Are they as good as my Canon 70D?  No.  But at about 1/10 the price in many situations they can  look just as good.This camera can also double as a "camcorder" -- a High Definition camcorder (720p). To give a rough idea about the quality, I'll compare it to a camcorder I bought circa 2002 for about $1100.  This camera "camcorder?" is FAR superior in virtually all categories.  One area it where it does fall short is battery life.  Stock up on those rechargeables.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Kimmai D.
Reviews.Content: uncle bought these for our family out of the USA. works and looks great so everyone is a happy camper

Reviews.Title: Good small camera
Reviews.Author: Deb Kiefer "storylady"
Reviews.Content: Worked great all around Paris.  Enjoyed using special effects.  Still having issues with volume on video. Nickel cad. Batteries a must!

Reviews.Title: love it but....
Reviews.Author: edgar cobos
Reviews.Content: im still having issues with the image stabilizing,all my pictures seem to be slightly out of focus, but all in all i love the resolution

Reviews.Title: Present
Reviews.Author: Serenity Horizon
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for one of my parents who had not yet moved from film cameras to digital.  So far I've been pretty impressed with the image quality and ease of use.  It seems to balance the two well.

Reviews.Title: Takes Excellent Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Zabrina Caldwell "Zabrina Caldwell"
Reviews.Content: I have had many different cameras.  The last one I had was pretty old, but it was wonderful, it was an older model Canon.  It was much more bulky and heavier than this one.It did take me a while to get used to the functions and such, but definitely love this camera.  The only thing I really didn't like about it, you have to manually pop the flash up.  On all my other cameras they have always just been stationary and off set from the top side.  All in all, definitely worth the price!  Super quick shipping and excellent packaging as well.  The camera would not have gotten damaged in transit unless something super heavy smashed it!

Reviews.Title: So glad we purchased this one!!
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: As for the ease of operation and quality of photos--it's, by far, the best I've ever had!!  Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: YES!
Reviews.Author: Rev. Dr. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, easy to maneuver, and produces excellent photographs!! I have used it several times on family outings and for personal use to create my own art materials and I am very pleased!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: rougebaisers
Reviews.Content: For the price this camera takes fab images.Great zoom. Easy controls. Canon image quality. Impressed for the price. Zoom is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Best investment this year
Reviews.Author: kelly
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my spring break, and man am I glad I did. It has the auto shoot function so even if you are camera challenged (or asking someone to take your picture and maybe not speaking the same language) you'll get an awesome picture 98% of the time (the other 2% accounts of photobombers, those sneaky bastards! or the blink mid picture)It takes AMAZING outdoor pics and excellent indoor pics in 90% of the dim/dark/indoor pictures I took. I highly highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: DIDN'T WORK
Reviews.Author: BARBARA ATKINS
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera after reading customer reviews.  I received it, installed batteries.  The memory chips I ordered at the same time never arrived.  I had to go and buy one at Target.  When  I turned on the camera, the telephoto lens extended and then camera said lens error.  Turn off and retry.  The lens never went back in.  When I tried to return it to the company that sent it, they sent me a return label.  I was on vacation and had no printer, and also no box to fix the extended camera.  I had to go to a UPS store and purchase a box and pay for a print out to send the camera back.  I haven't received a credit yet.

Reviews.Title: works great but
Reviews.Author: patrick bunsold
Reviews.Content: Really happy it runs on AAs!!!  great camera!But need a Manual for it"SX-160is for DUMMIES!!"not too easy to figure out without a manual

Reviews.Title: Bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Francesca M. Vanderwall
Reviews.Content: This camera works great. I took it with me overseas to keep a photo diary. I love that I have been able to take close ups of the moon (64x). The only issue is the stabilization. But I am going to try a tripod to see if this helps. Overall for the price I paid its been a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: The fact that this last years model runs on AA bateries instead of the expensive chargeable batery pack makes this a no brainer

Reviews.Title: Great When you get used to it.
Reviews.Author: K.B
Reviews.Content: I love the photo quality when I can get it perfect without my query (moving objects) blurring. Any photographer will tell you that that's a problem when you only get one moment to shoot something. If that's your deal then this camera isn't for you. But my still photo's come out perfect. The image quality is great. The video resolution is even greater. The zoom is superb. If there is something I can't see with the naked eye, sure enough the zoom on this camera will catch it; however, you need a really steady hand or tripod for anything above 16x. All in all, this is a great camera packed with a lot of power, and 16 mp that isn't overexaggerated. Wow! This isn't a DSLR, but I like it anyways.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: D Jean Schmidt
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera. It takes really nice pictures and videos. The battery life is very, very short, but I knew that when I ordered it and batteries vs. recharge cameras is the reason I purchased the SX160 IS. Using a rechargeable camera for the past couple of years, I'd often find myself with the battery power depleted; no place to recharge it; winding up using my cell phone camera for the remainder of our day.  The Canon PowerShop SX160 IS solved the problem, since I can very easily pack extra batteries in the case and continue with a working camera for the rest of the day. Again, battery life is extremely short on this camera *therefore, only 4 star review), but the trade-off was worth it for me. Other things I found nice on this camera were the various settings, which are easy to use and provides for good pictures in many different types of lighting/scenes. Also, the pop-up flash device is nice, since there is no question on whether or not the flash has been set when needed. All-in-all, very pleased with the camera. Also, the service was good. The camera was received very quickly after purchase and packaging was new and intact.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Lorraine Banks
Reviews.Content: I bought my son this camera for Christmas because it was inexpensive,  had many good reviews, and used double A batteries.  My son liked his camera so much, I bought one for myself and for my husband.  If you're just a casual photographer, don't need all the bells and whistles of a fancy camera, and don't want a camera with a rechargeable battery pack,  this Canon camera will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Older But Special
Reviews.Author: W. D. Anderson "montes del fuego"
Reviews.Content: Reviews indicated this item was supersceded by a new one, virtually identical but for the use of a proprietary battery to power the SX170. The features of the SX160 were, then, great to begin with. The optics are clean (comparable if not superior to the competitive N____). Ease of operation and responsiveness to commands - and changes in settings - are remarkable. For less money than the 'new & improved' I have a very acceptable camera for this price and features range, and the ability to use the best, and most reliable, power source I choose. Not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: No paper instructions
Reviews.Author: Robert F. Lakin
Reviews.Content: The camera seems great but there were no instructions included except on the Dvd which requires a computer to play. Big omission!

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Harold Blissitte
Reviews.Content: This is a very  good camera. I would recommend this camera to anyone. I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: I always buy Canon
Reviews.Author: pat foss
Reviews.Content: I have an older Power Shot that I love, but the battery door broke!  So I decided to get one with more zoom. I'm also used to the aa batteries (use lithium) and didn't want the battery pack.  My only complaint now is no user manual only cd rom which I have no way of using!!  Is there a manual available? Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Awesome
Reviews.Author: Greentre
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace and slightly upgrade an old pocket digital camera. Took it to Carlsbad Caverns to try it out. WOW! Once I learned some of the settings this camera is amazing. I really like the anti-shake feature and the digital zoom is incredible. I took a picture of an airplane sitting over a quarter of a mile away and it looks like you are standing at the nose of the plane. You can even tell the colors of the pigeon standing on the tail of the plane.The batteries I use, Duracell Alkaline, will last about 200 pictures depending on flash use. I put a 64GB memory card in it and that gives over 10,000 pictures worth of storage. The 3 inch screen is nice to see the shot; you don't have to squint at a little 1.5-2 inch screen and hope everything is in focus.My ONLY complaint is that the power button should have been put somewhere else. It's right behind the shutter button and on quick shots it's easy to hit the wrong button and turn the camera off instead of taking a picture.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Money!
Reviews.Author: DeeG "deeg1950"
Reviews.Content: Very nice and inexpensive camera.  Everything I expected and more.  Takes very good pictures.  Loan to my daughter for her new baby.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: I took the camera on vacation on a motorcycle and it was small enough but took awesome shots - to even win a contest with the prize being a free trip!!

Reviews.Title: A really good camera
Reviews.Author: suzanne m lecuyer
Reviews.Content: I was shopping around for an upgrade for my older Canon Powershot 580. My main need was taking decent photos of my jewelry for Etsy, so I needed a good upclose in natural light. I was looking at the SX170 and read a review that said this was essentially the same thing with a few minor differences. I didn't need it for action shots so I took a chance on this, half the price and does what I need perfectly, I haven't really tried it much for anything else but I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: canon the best
Reviews.Author: gusafro
Reviews.Content: good product woks very well and it have a good quality, good materials and good price i recommend it always

Reviews.Title: Great because it uses  AA-batteries!
Reviews.Author: J. Laskey ""a life-long learner""
Reviews.Content: After using a Canon Power-Shot A570 IS...I thought I'dlike to try a little camera from a RIVAL brand.  I purchased one of the little pocket cameras thatuses a lithium-ion battery.  Whew!  Without warning, thelithium battery would suddenly "run out of power"...andwithout warning, would send up a sign saying, "lowbattery" ---TOO LATE!  The opportunity for the phototo happen was gone.  Then, I saw this camera advertised in Amazon.  Read thereviews and found out that this SX160 IS used AA-batteries.HURRAH!I bought it and it hasn't quit on me! It lets me know when thebatteries are losing power, and I always have 2 spares withme...in case I need them. In other reviews you'll see variousgood points about this camera. I agree with all of them.Yet, it is most important to have a stable power source thatwarns you if it is wearing down.  I had to add this one because Photography has been myhobby since my dad taught me how to take pictureswhen I was a child. Though he took portraits, I've workedmostly on composition and landscapes. It is a beauty-filledworld out here if we look for it!  Happy picture-taking!

Reviews.Title: Great Item!
Reviews.Author: Marilyn S. Wachtler
Reviews.Content: the camera has surpassed our expectations......thank you!  Yes, we would reccommend this camera to everyone as a very good all around camera.

Reviews.Title: everybody knows it's your camera
Reviews.Author: L. Geocaris
Reviews.Content: loved the red color of this camera - bought it so we could easily pick out which was ours and it does have some fun effects (fishbowl, sepia, poster effect...)  But a little bulky/heavy for travel.  Good for our overseas trip as it takes regular batteries so we could just buy more if needed and not have to worry about charging with a converter and all that mess.  So good for what I needed it for but wouldn't purchase anything similar in future

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Donna L Francis "Life is hard.  It's even har...
Reviews.Content: Extremely easy to use, multiple settings for those of us who aren't professionals.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a camera.

Reviews.Title: SMILE
Reviews.Author: DEANGELIA B.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE ALL CANON PRODUCTS AND THIS IS MY 6TH CAMERA. THE PICTURE IS SO CLEAR AND PRETTY. THE CAMERA HAS SEVERAL FEATURES ON IT FOR A PROFESSIONAL OR AMATEUR. ANYONE WOULD BE ABLE TO OPERATE THIS CAMERA AND IT COMES WITH A BATTERY CHARGER. HOW GREAT IS THAT

Reviews.Title: excellent replacement camera
Reviews.Author: walter sheehan
Reviews.Content: this canon sx160-IS is a replacement for my non-working sx110-IS, it is more advanced than my older model but I believe I will be extremely pleased with its performance.  The instruction booklet and the DVD that were inclosed will be a great help.  thanks

Reviews.Title: Solid performer
Reviews.Author: URBANSCOUT
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera for a while now and love it. Has traveled well and shoots in a variety of conditions. Having to use AA batteries helps with traveling as you can always get new ones everywhere if needed as opposed to be somewhere to charge it. Is a bit larger because and its versatile zoom lens. Photo quality is terrific too!

Reviews.Title: Work fine- as expected
Reviews.Author: Robert Brater
Reviews.Content: I would have liked to have an optical viewfinder with this camera.Bright lighting & sunny days makes display viewing bad.Fairly compact.unit - - fits nicely in a small carry case.

Reviews.Title: 2nd Canon PowerShot I've owned
Reviews.Author: P. Brotzler
Reviews.Content: I'm a "point and shoot" type person and this camera does everything and more than what I want it to do.  I'm very pleased with it!

Reviews.Title: Loved It!
Reviews.Author: Tina J. Hodges
Reviews.Content: It is just what I was looking for. Perfect for me. Zoom worked great, it does what I need and then some.

Reviews.Title: Looks nice on the outside. Hard to use but not impossible.
Reviews.Author: Mr Suds
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot, it doesn't have a lot of good effects.I like the big LCD, and the fact that it kind of looks like an SLR.It has manual functions like shutter time and others.But honestly the images come out kind of grainy and it's hard to lock on with macro.If I had to buy this camera again, I'd pick something else.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA (for the second time)
Reviews.Author: Charlotte H Bailey
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use.  I had the previous model and dropped it and broke it.  I ordered this model (the next one up) and love it just as much.  I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera; have everything you need!
Reviews.Author: R. Diez
Reviews.Content: We like this camera for the price we payed for it, specially the large zoom allows to take closeups from quite far.Odds: it consumes much energy. Must have with you a pair of spare batteries ALWAYS.The case amazon recommends to buy with this camera is quite small. Quality is good but the camera fits quite tight in it. I think amazon should have to review this recommendation. we recommend people to see a larger case.

Reviews.Title: A great value, love this camera
Reviews.Author: JGTSJ
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. Photos are sharp, zoom works wonderfully, close up excellent. So far so great!  Works well for the photographer that requires a bit more than just " point and shoot".

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: jama555us
Reviews.Content: I bought the older brother: Canon SX170 IS last week. However, I found this one, the Canon SX160 IS, at a local retailer, on closeout. Price I won't disclose but I could not walk away from it.The only minor differences between the 160 and the 170 is that the 160 uses 2 AA batteries and the 170 uses a rechargeable battery.  Also, the flash on the 170 is a manual lift while the 160 has a push button release.The 160 is a little slimmer but not by much. The selector turn knob is a little different on the 160 vs. the 170.Either model, well worth the cost. In fact, I would say that they are not charging enough for the 160 or the 170 because the quality, ease of use, and the quality of the pictures are just great.I plan to have mine modified to full spectrum for ghost hunting. Hope this does not change the review. Just realize that the factory warranty is voided but I am okay with that.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working within a month of purchase
Reviews.Author: Happy Mom of 2 in Kentucky
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a present. We got it on time and delivery was very good. My brother loved the features. Very disappointing when within a month it stopped working properly. He has to turn it off every time it starts acting up, wait for about 30 minutes and turn it on again. This is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX160
Reviews.Author: Mary Oxford
Reviews.Content: Needed a camera capable of taking close-ups of jewelry as well as serving as my "everyday" camera for candid shots! Needed it right away -- got it right away!  Needed it to be user-friendly -- and it is!!  Only complaint is with Canon -- the software that came with the camera does not work. Canon blamed Microsoft -- Microsoft blamed Canon -- and neither has a fix for it...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera ....Sorta
Reviews.Author: chiefarchitect "chiefarchitect"
Reviews.Content: Started using this camera after using beginning type digital no brainer cameras.  It's a great solid feel and controls are fairly easy to understand.  Manual is well written and it takes excellent pictures with it's wide field of vision as well as macro controls.  The auto setting was fine for most of my shots and was very helpful to use when I had to get a shot off quickly and didn't have time to learn the proper way to take a particular shot.  My only negative is that the screen resolution/definition on the back of the camera does not really give a good impression of what you actually take.  The pictures come out much better then what is shown "live" on the screen when printed out or played back through a proper monitor or big screen.  I would comment further, but being a neophyte enthusiast I will stop here so that I don't lead readers astray with my amateur analysis.  All in all I really think it is a great step up from what I was used to using and the software provided gives a very easy way to edit all the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: I'm no pro, but am very happy with the performance so far. I see pictures friends upload from the same events and this camera does a better job. (Not comparing to pics from phones...that wouldn't be fair. :) )

Reviews.Title: The Camera Works Great
Reviews.Author: Joe Ingweiller
Reviews.Content: The Purchase of the Camera happened smoothly.The Camera Works fine, my son realy likes it.I would Purchase again from this Co.

Reviews.Title: The best!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I love Canon products,all my camera are Canons. I would defiantly recommend this camera for anyone that wants a small,easy to use camera!

Reviews.Title: ok point and shoot. Nice zoom.
Reviews.Author: J. G. Kerns
Reviews.Content: The zoom on this camera is pretty good. I'm what you might call an advanced amateur... I T.A.ed a couple photography courses back in college, but I'm no pro. I wanted a little knockaround P&S; to keep in my bag when I wasn't carrying my DSLR. Turns out that's not what I wanted at all... at least not this one. It's a bit too noisy for me.  If you work only in the bright outdoors, you'll probably like this camera just fine. I imagine it would be great at family snapshots at a theme park, but it's really kind of awful in low-light conditions.  If you're spoiled by APS-C-sized sensors like myself, it's just too hard to go back to a dinky little fingernail-sized sensor.I ended up giving this one to my Mom (her old 8mp Canon sub-compact P&S; was acting up) and getting myself an EOS-M. A mirrorless, interchangeable lens camera is nowhere near as portable as this guy, but at least I still smile when I see the images.

Reviews.Title: All around, good camera
Reviews.Author: Duane E Brown
Reviews.Content: The Cannon PowerShot SX160 performed to all of my expectations. Low light photos without flash are not real good. Unfortunately the camera does not come with a printed manual to take with you. The camera controls are easy to understand and use.

Reviews.Title: Glad I Took to India
Reviews.Author: Victoria A Schomer
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that's easy to use, takes excellent pics, and uses AA batteries. I got some great photos in India and Africa with it.

Reviews.Title: Fine camera
Reviews.Author: Tom W
Reviews.Content: One of the last Canon cameras that use AA batteries. I use 2 Lithium AAx9 Energizers. Great point and shoot. Wish it had fold out LCD like my PowerShot A 640

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Arlenny Andrea
Reviews.Content: The best camera I had had.Best pictures. Definitely worth the money. It's been amazing. It has a lot of good settings, though I use it in Manual. And I can set myt own apperture and shutter speed, wich it's great.

Reviews.Title: Best camera
Reviews.Author: Bill Devins
Reviews.Content: I should have bought this camera years ago.  It is easy to operate and takes great pictures.  It does take a steady hand when taking pictures using the zoom, but the image stabilization does help a lot.  Looking forward to using it more often.

Reviews.Title: My purse camera
Reviews.Author: Sue Gingrass "Sue G"
Reviews.Content: I enjoy my camera and love the zoom.  I showed my sister and she bought one also.  It is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the buck$
Reviews.Author: John Laubscher
Reviews.Content: The Cannon PowerShot SX160IS is a great camera for the buck$. Takes great pictures and does a nice job of Zooming is on subject. Also the ease in ordering thru Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Good starter camera for tween
Reviews.Author: Zan's mom
Reviews.Content: A good size and weight for her to handle with a decent zoom.  Takes great pictures.  I use it myself when I don't want to carry my big camera.  It would have received 5 stars, but there is no way to attach a neck/shoulder strap which would have made it a perfect camera for her.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price & quality !
Reviews.Author: Osvaldo J
Reviews.Content: Camera is great 16Mp/16 Optical zoom combination is great. The use of regular AA batteries is also a great advantage, I could not gave it a 5 star rating due to the slow flash and the fact it didn't came with at least a cheap SDHC card which most of today's cameras come with .... I still recommend it as a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Just-in-time
Reviews.Content: Needed a digital camera...that was not too expensive...this was good for the price ....to use on vacation trips,and not worry about losing an expensive camera.

Reviews.Title: A very good compact camera
Reviews.Author: Lee Gimenez
Reviews.Content: This is the second Canon Powershot camera I've bought, and both have been very good. The zoom range is excellent, as is the image stabilization feature.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Sue Elzey
Reviews.Content: I really do like this model, but I wish it had more options and settings. It was a great price tho!

Reviews.Title: Camera broke in 4 months Canon wants $117 to fix
Reviews.Author: Katharine Frazier
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in Aug, The lens stuck open and will not retract.  I sent it back to Canon and had to pay for that.  They say it is rusted and want $117 to repair.  It cost $157 with memory card

Reviews.Title: First Canon camera
Reviews.Author: SharBear
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use on vacation this past Nov 2013. After second use lens would not retract and closed. Broken lens motorafter 2 uses. For me this camera wasn't cheap in price but in it's self the camera was bad to only work 2 times.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for an amateur
Reviews.Author: Santiago
Reviews.Content: The camera is good, im surprise with the zoom that is amazing.. but the thing that i dont like is that the camera is with batteries AAA and they are done really quick...

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: iclarkec
Reviews.Content: Very versatile camera. I particularly like the zoom feature, the large screen display, the size  and cost of the camera.  Good buy!

Reviews.Title: NICE COMPACT DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: WARREN HOOTON
Reviews.Content: EASY TO HOLD, CONTROLS ARE HANDY. MISS THE OLD VIEW FINDER, FIRST CAMERA I HAVE THAT DIDN'T HAVE ONE. LIKE  HAVING AA BATTERIES IN CAMERA. INEXPENSIVE, AVAILABLE EVERYWHERE.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Black Keys
Reviews.Content: I bought this an an upgrade from my  previous point and shoot. I love all of the various settings and the ability to control all or some of the settings as I learn to be a better photographer. The improved zoom is already making a difference for me over my previous camera. This camera allows you to use regular batteries instead of the proprietary battery required for the SX170 while giving you all of the same features. I am very pleased with the purchase!

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Debra Sewell
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic! Has great optics and easy to learn to use too. Bought it for my boyfriend who knows little about techy things but knows photography and its products states the lens is really nice and clear without vinyetting (?sp). Took great Christmas pictures.

Reviews.Title: Does just what it's supposed to do!
Reviews.Author: Curtis G. Stratman
Reviews.Content: Easy to use -- small enough to carry easily anywhere -- takes great photos!  Only thing you could ask for would maybe be longer battery life!

Reviews.Title: As adverised......
Reviews.Author: William B. Otto III
Reviews.Content: Old model....  Don't think so....  It does a very above average job in all areas. Would purchase again in a heartbeat !!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Hornstuen
Reviews.Content: It is great for my simple needs, but there are some cons: Next camera I will get one that charges the flash faster..  You have to wait between pictures for flash pics and regular pics too.  Definitely not a camera for indoor perfection but it's adequate.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for being creative
Reviews.Author: KSArnold
Reviews.Content: Canon digital cameras are a bit silplistic.  I got one of these for the live feature.  That allows you to see what manual controls are doing when you adjust the color and brightness.  It should be helpful for being a bit creative which I like to do.  It only uses two AA batteries so it a bit thinner than some cameras with long lenses.  It is a bit heavier than a regular point and shoot.  All in all a nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera - Canon quality
Reviews.Author: darin krogh
Reviews.Content: Great small pocket camera.  Stabilizer important feature.  2 batteries good and bad, cheap but run out of power with a lot of flash pictures

Reviews.Title: great started camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Green
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this for my 4 year old grandson and I enjoyed using it myself. My grandson loves picture taking and is quickly learning how to use the basics of this camera. His father will help him with the more advanced features.

Reviews.Title: What I wanted
Reviews.Author: Judith Garcia
Reviews.Content: So glad I was able to get this camera to replace my 150 that was dropped and damaged. It meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX160iS
Reviews.Author: MTA
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this camera.  Read lots of reviews of various cameras and this is the one.  Just in time for holidays,  My son owns much costlier camera and he couldn't believe all the great features  Batteries not an issue - bought re-chargeable ones as suggested in reviews.

Reviews.Title: Clean, quality pictures.  Easy to Use.
Reviews.Author: Allan Bretz
Reviews.Content: If you want an easy-to-use, better quality camera, this is the one.  It will take great pictures quickly and clearly, as well as HD video. I like the fact that it takes AA batteries.  I never have to worry about having the battery charged up and can purchase extra batteries almost anywhere.  It's best to use Energizer Advanced or Ultimate lithium AA batteries too.  They will last a long time, unlike regular alkaline cells.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Thomas Fairbourn Jr.
Reviews.Content: Once again Canon has impressed me. They make fine cameras. My wife took her old camera in for repairs and the repairman said they had never seen a camera actually worn out. She takes lots of pictures

Reviews.Title: Camera fine, no manual included
Reviews.Author: ks4rmgrl "ks4rmgrl"
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived and works fine, but no manual was included. Just happened to have ordered one for another family member (from another seller) and it had the manual (but no software).

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, regular batteries
Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: Present for a former owner of an A1200, more pixels, better zoom.  Like Canon products, great image quality easy edits.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera at a good price.
Reviews.Author: Gail V
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It gives a very clear picture and is easy to use.  I chose this camera because it was a good price, but would recommend it to my friends and family because it is a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Steady hands required to make clear pictures.
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Lukiman
Reviews.Content: Pictures blurred if you move even a bit while pushing the shutter. Zoom quality is good. P mode many times better than AUTO mode. Pictures mostly good within 20 feet, more than that it occasionally lost focus. Low light exposure is really good, but far distance night shots rarely make crisp pictures. Flash does its job well, but not for far distance. Close up is good up to a few inches from the object, I used it to read very fine prints on electronics then viewed it in zoom mode. Tried all modes, can not get that great sunset shot like a very good camera. Screen has no frame to protect against scratch. Great pictures if your hands are very steady (standing still) and take time to half push the shutter to focus before pushing it all the way down. Battery life is shorter, but I can always bring or find extra AA batteries, thats what I love about this camera. Heavier than anticipated. On camera picture edit/crop and Movie mode is fine, but eats battery time.

Reviews.Title: Worked out great.
Reviews.Author: Marilee Harris
Reviews.Content: We are pleased with our purchase of this camera for our beginning photographer. Our 15 year old girl has been enjoying the ease and small size of her new camera. Who knows? She may one day be famous!

Reviews.Title: I like the features
Reviews.Author: D. Powell
Reviews.Content: I had previously owned another model of PowerShot camera and when it didn't survive after getting run over by a small tractor on a concrete surface I new exactly what I was going to get as a replacement. My hands aren't the steadiest and so I really appreciate the image stabilization. There might be others out there that do a better job but they are in a whole other price range than what I can afford. When I have it tripod mounted the optical zoom works great. There are features that I haven't even got around to exploring yet and I am still impressed with the quality of the shots that I have been able to achieve.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jerry Rutherford
Reviews.Content: These cameras eat AA batteries for lunch... I know that, and I expected that. But... rechargeable AA batteries are easy to get and not very expensive... so I keep about 6 with me when I go on photography trips. Additionally... unlike cameras with a proprietary battery pack... if my batteries are dead... I can hit any local store for regular ones and keep shooting... something you can not do with a fancy battery pack.The zoom in incredible to say the least... and FAST. I have the Canon SX130 IS, and purchased this one for a friend... now I'm jealous! The zoom is smoother, faster, and doesn't record the noise as did the 130. The images are crisp, and the detail at 12MP is superb. I find the camera to be a good weight and size and very easy to use. Plus... there are many special effects and filters built in.It has a PROGRAM mode where you can set the exposure, manual focus, etc... so you can do things that were formally in the realm of a $400 plus camera. I'm very happy with it.I only wish it had the capability to install a filter such as a polarizing filter... so for that I gave it a 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Tom "art2go"
Reviews.Content: It was easy to use and very happy with this product. Really can't go wrong with this camera and it was a great price as well. Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a camera in this price range and specs.

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: Batman#49
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional camera, quality of the pictures are great.  Price was very reasonable.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone interested in a simple to operate yet quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Cannon camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy Steele
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on our cruise awsome! The zoom is amazing.  Can't wait to figure out all the option on thus camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera and it takes good pictures.  The only complaint I have is that it doesn't come with its own rechargeable battery.  That would have taken it from a 4 star to a 5 star camera for me!

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Sam Twain "Sam"
Reviews.Content: I always had compact cameras so it was a step up for me and I'm glad I bought it. Easy to use and it takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but I'd make another choice if given another chance.
Reviews.Author: Karin Brown
Reviews.Content: I am a long time lover of canon products and wanted one to replace my old one from the same s-line because the mechanics had started to fade. I picked this model because I wanted something with replaceable batteries, having never gotten the hang of the rechargable ones. I like to travel and can buy AA's anywhere in a pinch, but if my charge dies and I miss a day of picture taking I'd be a very, very sad person.I've had this model for about a month and it has been acceptable. I know it's on the lower end of the price range, but I feel like the quality has gone down from the previous model to the current one. In low light, it really doesn't preform as well as I had expected. I'm also a person who likes to tinker, and I feel like this one has less settings and options than previous versions. The focus also has additional features that require a steep learning curve. I like the camera, it works for now, but I'm not in love like I have been in the past. It works for now, but I'm all ready itching to find a model that better fits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Purchase for myself
Reviews.Author: supiglet
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice, but is not one of the pocket size, that is okay for me.  The pictures are very good and the features it has are good.  Still learning how to do some of the things, it is capable of doing.

Reviews.Title: Better than average point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Leslie Frankel
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by 16 megapixels and x 32 lens. Pictures are clear and beautiful. Drawbacks: a little heavier than the average point and shoot you have to manually open the flash, and no matter how many times I have set time, date, etc, it keeps showing up every time I turn the camera on.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Alaskan Sprite
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, good quality. My only complaint is it uses AA batteries instead of having a rechargeable battery pack.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Casual Photographer
Reviews.Author: Kenneth W. Kerber
Reviews.Content: I tried this new camera for the first time on a short vacation and was very pleased by the results, The zoom allows for some great close up shots, and the image stabilization feature avoids blur even when using the full zoom. The camera is lightweight and fits easily into my pants pocket. The only downside that I've found is that the AA batteries run down pretty quickly, especially when using the flash. I think this is a great camera for the casual photographer who wants professional-looking photos.

Reviews.Title: Clear photos, good price
Reviews.Author: Marris
Reviews.Content: This camera has a very good picture quality and a great zoom.  I bought this after taking my SX120 to the beach and getting it full of sand, and it is great!  Very happy with my purchase.  Plus it's much more advanced than the 120 and cost $50 less than I paid for the 120 several years ago.

Reviews.Title: Xcellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Paul "Oldtin"
Reviews.Content: had a Canon Powershot SX110 which got drowned and didn't survive so I replaced it with the newest model and what a difference a few years made. Can't go wrong for the price. I'm still learning all the new features.

Reviews.Title: Uses batterys like crazy!!!!
Reviews.Author: Davidd10
Reviews.Content: This thing is a battery hog, and if your using the flash forget getting a quick shot, cause it won't happen. It takes good pictures but the camera is way to slow even without flash.

Reviews.Title: The quality of this item was below my expectations.
Reviews.Author: Lynn Bee
Reviews.Content: I am in the process of returning this item!  The release for the batteries and SDCH card does not open easily.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Sunshine Lover
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was expecting high quality photos but was disappointed by what I got.  The Kodak 10MP I currently own takes better quality pics than this Canon does!  I ended up returning this Canon and got an upgraded model Kodak for a third of the price!  The new Kodak is a lot easier to use (than the Canon) and the pics are much better quality. Too bad Kodak won't be making cameras anymore.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Hansen
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera!  I was upgrading from a very old Kodak.  The zoom on this camera is great.  I've also used the recording video and it has great video and sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Good quality specs.
Reviews.Author: Calm
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the SX160 as I needed a camera using AA batteries, but which had a fairly long zoom and good movie quality.

Reviews.Title: so happy
Reviews.Author: Bruce Webb
Reviews.Content: had Nicon L22 that broke on vacation. Taped it up and got buy but bought the SX160 to replace. Sooooooo Happy!!!! Price was best we found. Now this is the best point and shoot we ever owned. Have a DSL and use this more. I love it!  -Linda

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Kennedy "Sylvia Kennedy"
Reviews.Content: My camera arrived in good condition and on time. I am still learning how to use it, but am happy the way it fits in my hand and easy to focus. I love the powerful zoom.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries for breakfast
Reviews.Author: MAcDarby
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation because I wanted something that would shoot manually and was smaller than a DSLR. Big mistake. It eats batteries for breakfast, so you better have a ton of extra for lunch and dinner.No joke, just shooting on manual with no flash, all power was drained in an hour. There were times I had no camera, even though I brought spare batteries, and had to use my phone which was frustrating and disappointing.The photo quality is good in optimal lighting, but shutter lag is significant with flash.

Reviews.Title: decent camera decent price
Reviews.Author: G. Dale Greenawald
Reviews.Content: Ordered an SX 150 that arrived in non functional condition. Takes clear  photos ,but you need a year to study all of the settings, switches and buttons to know what they do. Wish someone made  a camera where all you did weas pointand shoot it!

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: We love this camera.  It has great zoom and is fairly easy to use for the average use.  The price was perfect and you get more than I expected

Reviews.Title: Flash Fill Quality
Reviews.Author: James Priday
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that could be made to fill flash in daylight.  This camera is programmable to do that!Wonderful

Reviews.Title: My Canon SX160 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Alexander K. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This camera is has excellent zoom and very easy to use. Best of all, it is easy to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: teymur
Reviews.Content: Nice picture and video quality, zoom, flash... After take a photo, flash recharge needs about 1 second(if it's turned on).Small and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Wide angle optical
Reviews.Author: darla hare
Reviews.Content: This camera lives up to other Canon cameras I have purchased with the enhancement of the great zoom!! Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: James F. Judd
Reviews.Content: I love the camera ,the only thing I would like to see change is when taking a move you could phase and start again with the move.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Betsy Pérez
Reviews.Content: I' m very happy with this product...It was received in Caracas -Venezuela in perfect state. Thank you to amazon for excellent service. I love this camera.. I recomend it for his excellent photos.

Reviews.Title: Works great for amateurs
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boyfriend so we could take pictures on our upcoming SoCal trip. The quality is great and exactly what we need to snap quick photos!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jojo
Reviews.Content: Just the right size for snap and shoot picture taking.Easy directions for someone who is not a pro at photography.Would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powersot SX 160 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Eugene Stransky
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfied with purchase. We purchased this camera for a upcoming trip to England, France and Belgium. Our existing camera had poor picture quality. And we are very happy with the excellent picture quality of the new camera. We would recommend  the SX 160 to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: bob r
Reviews.Content: I'm not a camera buff, so this one works great for me. Relatively inexpensive and easy to use. The companion program is also easy to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for 12 year old.
Reviews.Author: Lisa Morelli
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and sturdy.  Only complaint is that batteries run out too quickly.  Buy rechargeables and you are all set.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT SX160
Reviews.Author: Alton Rogers "AGR"
Reviews.Content: We are in our high eighties and still traveling. I bought this for my wife when her old Canon gave up the ghost. She says this is the best camera she has ever had. Easy for her to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bre2389
Reviews.Content: I only dapple in the world of photography, and was looking for a camera that was easy to use but would take great photos and videos.  I was going on a major trip abroad for the first time, so I made the investment.  Easy to carry around and I have hundreds of beautiful photos and videos so far.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Anna Gregov
Reviews.Content: I really, really love this camera.  I have a PowerShot540 (not bad), and a T2i, which is just so big!  This camera is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX160 IS
Reviews.Author: Florentino Santiago "Florentino Santiago"
Reviews.Content: So far, the camera has been great.  Takes beautiful photos and is easy to handle. Is a great camera for begineers and Pro

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: N. Kydonieus
Reviews.Content: I have been buying Canon products for years now becauseo be the best for the money.hem t I have found t

Reviews.Title: good camara
Reviews.Author: Bethzaida
Reviews.Content: .I like the camara I got. I would buy the camera again if I had to. Good for the price. Pictures were nice and clear.

Reviews.Title: Camera savvy, I am not
Reviews.Author: constance standish
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use it.  I am somewhat challenged with cameras.  I like it so far.  Ask me again in one month and maybe i will be more positive.

Reviews.Title: For the price
Reviews.Author: TS Chamberlain
Reviews.Content: I was on a budget and need something light, and I am pleased with the quality of this camera and its photos considering all of that. The digital display is horrific in quality--the images look much better once uploaded.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Devin Perez
Reviews.Content: Okay, I needed a upgraded camera and this one is PERFECT. The battery life dosent last that long. The quality is 100%. I love this camera and YES - I would reccomend this camera. Thank you Canon.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Johnnie Conley
Reviews.Content: The camera woks fine. However, when recording in HD the camera really kills the batteries. They last about 1/2 hour..Not satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for a relative
Reviews.Author: Brian Bear
Reviews.Content: As a first time digital camera user, they love it. It took a little practice, but after a few hours, they had learned all the features of this nice little camera. Next, they will need a PC.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my mom
Reviews.Author: Cindy Harriss
Reviews.Content: I know the review is late and I'm sorry!! The camera is great, mom carries it every place she goes, especially if any of her grandkids and great grandkids are going to be there. Great product, arrived quickly and packaged perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Gary W Long
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot with flexible settngs and great zoom capabilities. Easy to hold and shoot. Good for those who dont like to fumble around with settings.

Reviews.Title: this cam is just awesome
Reviews.Author: Shivaguru Subbiah "shiva"
Reviews.Content: This is just a perfect camera within budget. The only disadvantage is that it takes a while to save pictures. I loveeeee it

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift.
Reviews.Author: GrammaLuLu
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon fan for many years. This is a model up from the one requested as a gift so should be just right.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: swh60
Reviews.Content: Was great for price. USES BATTERIES, great because you don't have to worry about recharging when off on a trip. Only problem having trouble taking pics when sky in background, the subject turns out dark, am working on that.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: i'm totally satisfied with this Canon PowerShot SX160 Digital Camera. Canon is a good product, and is easy to use .

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a senior citizen.
Reviews.Author: Alfred Baum
Reviews.Content: Love 16x wide angle optical and 3 " screen, zoom and 16.0 mp.easy to handle for a senior man. Weight is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Laureen Terry Irvin
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter, who has been having a great time trying out the various settings and taking lots of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Beautifully simple
Reviews.Author: Sleepyquad
Reviews.Content: This was my second digital camera by this manufacturer because I was so satisfied with the first one.  So far I have only used it just enough to become familiar with it so I cannot elaborate at this time.  It is very well made and it looks and feels very smart.  I'm impressed with the optical zoom capabilities, especially the image stabilization feature.  I will know more after I have gone on vacation later this month.  I am sure that I will be very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: BT
Reviews.Author: Betty Tillman
Reviews.Content: Canon is a good product. This camera is easy to use and the pics are so clear. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: J. T. Smith
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty ok. It takes terrible shots of my daughter because she it always moving. It smears with even the slightest movement. It is really only good for still photos and it is awesome at that, so keep that in mind. I bought it on a lightning deal so I don't feel screwed.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: m.turner
Reviews.Content: This was the third camera that I bought in my search for a camera that was not too bulky, had a decent zoom, and could take monochrome pictures (I love having the option of taking sepia and black and white pics!) I bought a Samsung, an Olympus, and this Cannon. They were all good cameras for the price, especially since I got the Olympus on a REALLY good sale) but this was the only one of the three that could do the monochrome easily. So far I absolutely love it. The only down side is that it does not take spectacular action shots.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Gillispie
Reviews.Content: great camera. we have a cannon model a few years older but i like this one a lot better. the point ant click feature is amazing and it takes amazing videos!!!! highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: William T. Fix, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife.  She takes many pictures and is picky with her pics.  She loves this camera and uses it often.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Marrco
Reviews.Content: I bought this SX 160 because a friend has the SX 130 and we liked it so much.This camera is even better. It has HDMI and USB ports on it for flexibility.16x  zoom goes to 64X digitally for very close up shots.I bought rechargeable AA batteries they work great. I had only one set of 2 in it for my whole 9 day vacation without needing to change them. Very good power management!Many people don't realize the huge advantage of cameras that use AA batteries. Most cameras have battery packs that must be recharged and eventually repurchased at a high cost. It's something to consider when shopping, see what kind of batteries it takes.A great deal for $149.

Reviews.Title: Point & shoot
Reviews.Author: G.V.
Reviews.Content: This camera was chosen to add to our selection of cameras because we wanted a simple point and shoot camera to grab when we went walking. It is light weight and fills its purpose.

Reviews.Title: love this
Reviews.Author: brandon
Reviews.Content: great camera does al i will need it looking forward to many nice photo's to come. also got at great price

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX 160 a6.o MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Doris Z. Lampe
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in plenty of time to take pictures of family and other visitors over the Christmas holidays. The pictures were great.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: SHARYN LANGE
Reviews.Content: I had this camera before and dropped it and broke it - I set out to buy another of the same thing as I love this camera- takes great pics- easy to operate- Does a great job with the zoom in-

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: pda "palarcon"
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best can take great pictures from far away and bright it near as you were standing in front.

Reviews.Title: so glad i bought it
Reviews.Author: lena criss
Reviews.Content: I had one identical to this one but the model older for years and it finally  died  and I got this one. Its the best. After I played with it for a while and got to know it ,its perfect for fast action  shots of my cats and daughter.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: melody brooks
Reviews.Content: takes great pictures. I was worried it was to big. It's not. You will love it.and the red gets alot of compliments

Reviews.Title: Nifty little camera
Reviews.Author: John Pelkey
Reviews.Content: I own fancier cameras, but the Canon sx160is is the one I take hiking or to the beach. It has a great feel, easy to use, great zoom, and takes better photos than you think you are getting. Also, the digital zoom (64x) is great for reading signs a quarter mile away. Not an action shot camera or a low light camera without the flash. But it does what I want it to. And for hiking, it fits in my jeans pocket and doesn't compete with my pack. Nice feature is the 2 AAs it takes. Easy to carry spares. For those who wonder how I get 150 shots vs. the 130 most people indicate, it will take about 20 photos after the low battery light comes on. When the batteries wear out, it turns itself off so you always know when to change them.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SX160
Reviews.Author: Dwight A Dodge
Reviews.Content: I love the camera.  I am a point-n-shot person and this camera takes wonderful pictures.  I can even use some of the non "auto" settings

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, Great Quality pictures
Reviews.Author: David Moody "music man"
Reviews.Content: I had an older model Canon, so when I upgraded, I decided to get another Canon. I love the quality of the pictures that it takes. There are several different functions to the camera that are very useful.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: Christine Araujo
Reviews.Content: I dropped my earlier version of this camera *SOB* and when I realized it was DOA, I quickly bought this updated version.Haven't had a chance to REALLY give it a workout but overall, I am very happy and I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Dean Horikami
Reviews.Content: The Canon camera is very easy to use.  I have never owned a digital camera before.  I will enjoy the use of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift!
Reviews.Author: Anthony R. MONTOYA
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift from my husband (ARM)  I like it very much so far.  It is bigger than tiny one I had - easier to use.  I have not experimented very much with it yet...but what I have done has been great!  I would recommend it to non-experts like me.  I don't know if experienced photographers would require more...but I like it!!

Reviews.Title: Like profecional, but compact
Reviews.Author: Camilo Ortegón
Reviews.Content: It has many of the profesional features, like setting the time of the shut to get the most light as posible... its perfect for fans of photography

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Camera with Great Performance
Reviews.Author: Joyce Johnson "Panda"
Reviews.Content: I received the Canon PowerShot SX160 as a gift from my husband.  I am a novice, but my this camera is easy to use and produces great pictures with mostly automatic settings.

Reviews.Title: Picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Hines Family
Reviews.Content: I love the price, the quality of the pictures, the compactness which makes it easy to always have in my purse.  Excellent buy for the quality and technology

Reviews.Title: Perfect point and shoot with manual capabilities.
Reviews.Author: Lynn Stanphill
Reviews.Content: After buying one of these for myself, I was so impressed, I purchased one for the children. The pics and video is fantastic quality - especially considering the price!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Phelps "ccf rider"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my old Canon powershot.  So far this camera has exceded my expectations.  Great price for a very nice easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: I'm underwhelmed
Reviews.Author: Mr. Lundt
Reviews.Content: I am loyal to Canon so it is disappointing that I cannot give this camera a better review. There may be many good features on this camera but two issues prompted me to return it. First, it seems to eat through AA batteries pretty quickly. I was only able to take about 40 pictures (most of which used the flash) before I needed to replace the batteries. Second, I had to wait nearly 12-15 seconds between shots while the screen said "charging flash".  Try asking your four-year-old to stop opening a Christmas present while the camera recharges the flash.  I will be returning this in favor of something else.

Reviews.Title: Grandson Loves It
Reviews.Author: Tony Z
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my grandson and he has been taking some wonderful photos with it. The shots rival those taken with my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Scrapmccall
Reviews.Content: This is the third canon camera I've owned--upgrading each time and always impressed with the clarity of the pictures and ease of use. I love that it uses AA batteries--so I can always be ready to go no matter where I am!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: shaleen
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Easy to use. Great pictures. Uses Batteries fast. Great Zoom like the LCD display ...................

Reviews.Title: great images
Reviews.Author: S. Lee Harper "Zuni"
Reviews.Content: Really happy with product after contacting Canon and getting a bit of coaching.  The software provided on disk is a bit of a pain for easy upload like the older Powershot, but more than makes up for it with in expanded functions.  I have Adobe Creative Suite, so thought it would just be duplicating functions but really helpful.  Really great shots in low light.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera.
Reviews.Author: Cathy L. Heinze
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  POINT and SHOOT is all about this camera. Amazing pictures.  Better then the Sony Camcorder I use in my business. Picture quality and richness in color is far better.  I would recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Brinda Myers
Reviews.Content: Takes awesome pics and movies even close up. No tripod needed! Easy to use but not pocket friendly. You need a camera bag but it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: For the price you cant beat it.
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera with tons of features. I think this is the best camera under $400. Next step after this thats worth it is a rebel.

Reviews.Title: Never a bad picture. Easy to use. Great for close-ups.
Reviews.Author: Ronald Myers
Reviews.Content: I have owned other Canon digital cameras but the SX160 is the best one so far. It is easy to use and doesn't require use of a tripod for close-ups even thought it can be fitted to one. The auto focus is right on all the time.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!  Cannon products are the best as well as their customer service.
Reviews.Author: Jean Damron
Reviews.Content: Great product!  Cannon products ar the best as well as their customer service.  Would not buy another brand of camera.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: Deb Schmid
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon powershot for about 5 years, and I dropped it with the lens out, and it stopped working, so I bought this one.  I love it, the zoom is clear, and it takes great video.

Reviews.Title: christmas gift for my daughter
Reviews.Author: marquez
Reviews.Content: i used the camera before i gave it to my daughter,it took great pictures, and we loved the zoom lens, first canon camera i ever bought. the  sx150is i have too say i hope she keeps this camera in good working order thank you canon and i hope my daughter likes this as much as i do

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: jesse_hansen
Reviews.Content: I found this camera extremely amazing! The amount of mega pixels really give the photo a crisp feel. Also the screen is very large which makes it more easier to see what you've just shot. I have never been so happy with a camera than this one. One thing I do have an issue with is how fast it uses up batteries but that is why i just ordered rechargeable ones. Great camera and I 100% recommend this

Reviews.Title: pictures are cloudy....bad camera.
Reviews.Author: Desiree D. Barnett "dbqueue"
Reviews.Content: Too late to return. The pictures I took on vacation are blurry. It was a mistake to buy this camera. My IPad2 takes better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Terrible with battery power
Reviews.Author: Kare1280
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this camera and was surprised to see the amount of battery power it uses even when not using the flash. I went through 6 batteries for a 70 minute long concert. Not good at taking action photos in low light many came out blurry. I loved my old PowerShot which I used for 6 years. This one I can't wait to replace it after just a few days of owning it.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life, Image Stabalization is a joke
Reviews.Author: J. Perrault
Reviews.Content: I've never had a bad experience with a Canon camera until now.  First of all, this camera eats batteries for lunch.  Secondly, the image stabilization is virtually non-existent on any image taken with more than a 5x zoom.  And while it is commonly advertised as featuring a speed burst mode, be aware that this is for short bursts only.  The camera will then take time to process the images during which you will not be able to take any additional pictures.  But you'll find that you won't use it much because the camera isn't designed for anything moving faster than a casual stride.Overall, this would be a fine product if it was released 10 years ago.  There are just better options out there today.

Reviews.Title: Does not have color accent option
Reviews.Author: Kelley Orme "kykowgal"
Reviews.Content: I had a canon sx130is camera before I dropped it and it broke. So, I wanted another one just like, but with some updated features. So, I contacted canon before I purchased this camera and specfically asked if this camera had the color accent option because I really liked that option on the sx 130is. There are many different websites out there and some say it has it and some say it does not. The canon rep that I talked to in VA, reassured me it had the color accent option. So, I bought it. When the camera came in, I tried it out, but I could not figure out how to work the color accent option. So, I contacted canon again. Another rep wrote back and said, sorry, this camera does not have the color accent option. So, I am returning it. The 160 camera is lighter weight than the 130, and does have the i movie option, but overall, I feel it is cheaply made and does not offer as many options as the 130. I think canon missed the boat on this camera. I really wanted an updated camera, but this does not work for me. I hope they bring it back to this series with the new update.

Reviews.Title: GOOD! But takes getting use to!
Reviews.Author: Nicole Burkemper
Reviews.Content: This camera has an awesome zoom! I really like the quality of pictures it takes! This is NOT a point and shoot camera! You have to let it focus in and adjust before taking a picture! Also the battery life isn't the best but it takes pretty great pictures esp at concerts!

Reviews.Title: Delayed flash frustration
Reviews.Author: T. Braskey
Reviews.Content: This was my first Canon Camera.  I do a lot of night shots.  I am aware most cameras are not made to do night shots.  However, you can do night shots if you have a good flash.  I had no idea Canon has this frustrating very delayed flash.  I swear my 12 Megapixel Kodak Easy Share came through on every single flash immediately.  I assumed a Canon camera would be better.  I got out to do my night shots.  I must have tried to take 150 photos.  I couldn't tell if the camera was taking them or not.  I did not see a flash.  Only 6 photos came out of 150!  I was used to pointing, shooting and seeing the flash the minute I hit and released the camera button.  Taking multiple series of shots.  I admit to never using Canon and not reading the instructions.  Apparently you have to hold down the camera button, then there is a long delay while the camera tries to find it's focus.  So, I feel like I wasted $168, plus shipping.  This camera might take amazing daytime shots, but I simply will not work for my night shots.  I stupidly threw away the box and can not return the camera or I would.  It just won't work for my needs.  I wouldn't expect most camera to do night shots with clarity, but I would expect an immediate flash.  So this was just so upsetting.  I called Canon to ask if they have any cameras that flash immediately?  They suggested an SLR model, and said any other Canon Flashes the with the same delay.  So I wouldn't even try another  Canon.  I would have been better off with a 16mp pocket aim and shoot camera.  I just ordered the camera a week ago and it's just sitting in the drawer with me questioning what will I use it for?  I am not one of those people who complain.  I am usually a person who likes everything I buy and never sends anything back.  If I would have kept the box ... the SX160 would be on it's way to return.  I wish I could get my money back and order the Nikon D3200 24.2 mp SLR.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this camera
Reviews.Author: Judi Z
Reviews.Content: I've had a powershot SX140 for a while, so I was happy to see the SX160 with 16 megapixels and a 16X Zoom.  Felt enough had changed between the 140 and the 160 to warrent upgrading.  I recently took my new SX160 on a trip and was very pleased with the pictures I got with it.  Even pictures taken from a seaplane through the window came out great.  Even with a lot of zoom there was only a couple of pictures with some blur.  I've been buying Canon cameras for quite a while and have always been very pleased with them.  One thing I like about the SX models is that they use AA batteries, 'cause no matter where I am I can always find those if I need them.  Generally I buy the lithium AA's and don't have any problem with one set lasting more than 400 pictures.  This camera also fits into my purse which is great for a camera with so much zoom.  I take a lot of landscape pictures, so I definitely use the zoom a lot.

Reviews.Title: Camera is AMAZING!!
Reviews.Author: Bradford Harrison
Reviews.Content: My favorite feature of this camera is the zoom. It zooms past the 16x ( takes a few seconds to focus once you zoom further out) to get better pictures of further away objects. I took a picture of the moon with the zoom all the way out and got incredible shots. You can see all the craters and the glow on the moon. Truly beautiful pictures for being an ordinary camera. I recommend this camera to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: decent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: CuriousCat
Reviews.Content: I think my pictures were just so-so.  I left it set on the automatic setting though, and am not real knowledgeable.  I did like the zoom feature on some far away sites.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera, can have nice quality pics, but flash kills the deal.
Reviews.Author: adam6979 "adam6979"
Reviews.Content: For the money of this camera I expected better. I typically use the Point and Shoot cameras and thought this would be a nice upgrade. It take okay pics - nothing fancy or great but the flash was the deal breaker. This take 2-8 seconds after each picture to "Charge The Flash" as the camera says. This feature renders it useless for me and I am returning it for a full refund and bought an Olympus instead. First Canon camera and probably going to be the last.

Reviews.Title: takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: Grippy "WR"
Reviews.Content: Takes very good pictures. Easy to use. Takes AA batteries. All it has to do now is last. Nice red color

Reviews.Title: WIFE KNOWS BEST
Reviews.Author: LLOYD D SMITH
Reviews.Content: MY WIFE HATES THIS CAMERA. .FIRST SHE COMPLAINED ABOUT THE BATTERIES DYING TOO QUICKLY UNTIL I GOT HER THE RCHARGABLE , NOW THE PICTURE QUALITY IS TOO GRAINY.

Reviews.Title: Suggestion warning
Reviews.Author: Busy Mom
